Nelvie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable retail business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 4 years and also earns more income from a general store and raising pigs.   Nelvie is borrowing PHP 16000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell for her vegetable retail business.  

Nelvie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of being able to repair and renovate her family home in the future and save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy vegetables to sell

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a beauty salon business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 20 years now.

Cecelia requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional equipment for her business.   In the future, Cecelia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy beauty salon equipment

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 45 years old and married with 7 children.  She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines.  Gina has been raising livestock for 20 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

Gina is borrowing PHP 15000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy livestock

loans.name: Roger

texts.en: Roger, a 35-year-old single man who lives in the Philippines, has been providing habal-habal or motorcycle services for six years. Having joined HSPFI this year, he is requesting a loan for 4,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the gasoline his service uses.  In the future, Roger hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 38 years old from Nakuru and is married with two children who are aged between 12 years and six years old.

Ibrahim has a retail business that he has been doing for the past four years and has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him to buy more sugar, cooking fat and rice to add to his stock for sale.

He hopes to see his business expand in the near future and be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat and rice for resale.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 48 years old. He is married to Lucy and together they have two children. He is a farmer and has been in the business for the past 11 years.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET by a credit officers. He will use the loan amount to plow his land for planting and purchase seedlings for planting on his farm

He hopes to expand his farming business by purchasing another piece of farming land.

loans.use: to plow the land for planting and purchase  planting seedlings

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 55 years old, married and a father of three school-going children. For the last eight years, he has earned a living from a retail business where he earns a monthly profit of KES 15,000.
 
He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers and is applying for his fourth loan of KES 60,000 which he will use to purchase additional stock of sugar, rice and flour for his retail shop business. He anticipates an increase in profits which he plans to reinvest back into the business.

In future he dreams of having a happy family and expanding his business further.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of sugar, rice and flour.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Francisca, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Asunta de Racsa” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se sigue dedicando al comercio de papas al por mayor y menor, trabajo que viene realizando hace años, el cual ha podido levantar y desarrollar para beneficio de su familia. Francisca provee de este tubérculo a diferentes mercados de la ciudad del cusco, mercado que ha sabido expandir gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo, Nuestra socia en esta oportunidad invertirá su préstamo para capitalizar su actividad y comprará diferentes especies de papas al por mayor, para cubrir su mercado y demanda.
Francisca está muy agradecida con KIVA por ayudarla con la educación de sus hijos y por permitirle mantenerse con su actividad y llevar el sustento a su casa.
texts.en:
Meet Francisca: she is a member of the communal bank “Virgen Asunta de Racsa” and comes from the city of Cusco, Peru. For many years she has made a living by selling potatoes. She has managed to improve and develop her business, and her family has benefited from this. 

Francisca supplies potatoes at different markets around Cusco. Thanks to her hard work and efforts she has managed to expand her customer base. She plans to invest her loan in funding her business. She will buy different varieties of potatoes wholesale, in order to target her market niche and meet demand.

Francisca is very grateful to KIVA for helping her to educate her children and for allowing her to keep her business going and provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes wholesale.

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es:
La señora Maximiliana tiene 50 años de edad, es madre y padre para su unico hijo, ella nació y vive en la ciudad de Oropesa a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal de la socia es la elaboración de pan. Ya son 15 años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

La señora Maximiliana es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que le invitaron a participar del banco Comunal “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa. En esta oportunidad la señora Maximiliana requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de azúcar, sacos de harina y otras cosas más. 

La señora Maximiliana agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Maximiliana is 50 years old and is mother and father to her only son.  She was born and lives in the city of Oropesa, located 30 minutes from the city of Cusco.  Her main financial activity is baking bread.  She has been in this business for 15 years and things are going well for her.

Maximiliana is a very enterprising and hardworking woman who was invited to participate in the Arariwa Association’s communal bank, “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa.”  On this occasion Ms. Maximiliana needs a loan to buy supplies, such as sacks of sugar, flower, and other things.

Maximiliana appreciates the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Katia Diana

texts.es:
La señora Katia tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera, ella nació y vive en la ciudad de Oropesa a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal de la socia es la crianza de animales menores y también tiene una pequeña tienda de multi servicios. 

La señora Katia es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que le invitaron a participar del banco Comunal “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa. En esta oportunidad la señora Katia requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de azúcar, sacos de harina y animales menores como cuyes.  

La señora Katia agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Katia is 28 years old and she is single.  She was born and lives in the city of Oropesa, 30 minutes from the city of Cusco.  Her main business is raising small animals and she also has a small convenience store.

Katia is an enterprising and hardworking woman who was asked to join Asociación Arariwa's Virgen Asunta de Oropesa Communal Bank.  Katia currently needs a loan to buy supplies, such as sacks of sugar, sacks of flour, and small animals, such as guinea pigs. 

Katia is thankful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies, such as sacks of sugar, sacks of flour, and small animals, such as guinea pigs.

loans.name: Antonieta Gladis

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora Antonieta, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Asunta de Racsa” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia es una joven madre de una niña de 7 meses de nacida, que se dedica al comercio de vasijas, que son sacos de fibra de plástico para la contención de  papas, frutas y granos, Antonieta puso este negocio al ver la necesidad de sus compañeras de mercado que utilizan mucho estos sacos para comercializar sus productos, y además aprovecha para vender algunos otros productos como bebidas gaseosas, galletas, y golosinasEl sueño de Antonieta es verla crecer a su hija sin necesidades que en algún momento ella pasó, ofrecerle una buena educación y algún dia heredarle esta actividad que ella quiere hacer crecer y desarrollar.
Antonieta en esta oportunidad invertirá el préstamo solicitado para comprar sacos de fibra de plástico al por mayor y arpilleras para cumplir con su demanda y capitalizar su actividad. Antonieta está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por ayudarla con el crecimiento y fortalecimiento de sus actividades.
texts.en:
Antonieta belongs to the “Virgen Asunta de Racsa” communal bank in the city of Cusco, Perú.  She’s a young mother of a seven-month-old daughter.  She sells containers consisting of plastic fiber sacks used to store potatoes, fruit and grains.  She started the business when she noticed that her fellow merchants in the market use these types of sacks very much to sell their products and she also takes advantage of the opportunity to sell other types of goods like soft-drinks, cookies and snacks.  Antonieta’s dream is to see her daughter grow without the privations she had to go through, offering her a good education and someday pass down to her this business that she wants to make grow and develop.

On this occasion, Antonieta will use the requested loan to buy plastic fiber sacks at wholesale and burlap to meet demand and capitalize her activity.  Antonieta is very grateful to KIVA for making it possible for her to give her family a better quality of life and helping her with the growth and strengthening of her business.

loans.use: to buy plastic fiber bags and burlap.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es:
La señora Lucila tiene 41 años de edad, tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, ella nació y vive en la ciudad de Oropesa a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal de la socia es la venta de productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo leche, fideos, aceite, harina, azúcar, arroz y otras cosas más.  

La señora Lucila es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que le invitaron a participar del banco Comunal “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa. En esta oportunidad la señora Lucila requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de azúcar, sacos de fideos, detergentes, sacos de arroz y otras cosas más. 

La señora Lucila agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Lucila, 41, lives in a common law relationship and has four children.  She was born in and still lives in the city of Oropesa thirty minutes from the city of Cusco.  Her main economic activity is selling basic staples like milk, noodles, oil, flour, sugar, rice and other things.

Lucila is an enterprising, hardworking woman who was invited to participate in Asociación Arariwa’s “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” communal bank.  On this occasion Lucila needs the loan to buy merchandise like sacks of sugar, sacks of noodles, detergent, sacks of rice and other things.  She is grateful for the loan and commits to make her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Bashir

texts.en:
Bashir is 31 years old. He and his wife Ericah are blessed with a two-month-old baby.  He owns a barber shop, a business he started 10 years ago, and in which he earns a monthly income of 17,000 Kenya shillings (KES).

He is requesting for his first loan of 20,000 KES to purchase two hair cutting machines. The profit he earns from his business will help him boost his wife's business. He dreams of owning a car someday.

loans.use: To purchase two hair cutting machines.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is a resident of the Likoni area of Coast province, Kenya. She is married and has three children; all of whom attend school. She owns a second-hand clothes shop, a business that she has been operating for thirteen years. The family also gets some income from the husband's employment. 

She learnt about Milango through an employee and joined the company with the aim of accessing credit to improve the operations of her business. Her main challenges are that some customers do not pay on time and that the clothes have high purchase prices. 

Jacqueline is applying for a loan of 31,450 Kenya shillings to purchase bales of second-hand clothes. The extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to pay school fees for her children. She aspires to start a transport business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Iwo Jima

texts.en:
Iwo Jima is 47 years old and married with one child.  Iwo Jima works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from food supplements retailing.

Iwo Jima requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell in her general store.  She has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan.  She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 2 years.  Mary is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Mary has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to repair and renovate her family home in the future.

loans.use: repair her fishing boat

loans.name: Mylinda

texts.en:
Mylinda is 35 years old and married with 3 children.  She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.   Mylinda has been raising pigs for 16 years and also earns additional income from meat vending.

Mylinda is borrowing PHP 18000 through NWTF to buy additional feeds and vitamins for her pigs.  She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ruchie

texts.en:
Ruchie is 23 years old and married with one child.  Ruchie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been running the store for one year and also earns an income from food vending.

Ruchie has requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.  She has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Ruchie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 31 years old and married with six children.  Marites works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari sari store in the Philippines.  She has been running the store for 12 years and also earns an income from selling cucumbers.

Marites requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.  She has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Marites aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: buy items to sell in her store

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en:
Sandra is 55 years old and married with 5 children. With 3 children in school, Sandra works very hard to provide for them.

Sandra runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 4 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, spices, canned goods, etc.

Sandra requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell for her general store.  In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Cresencia

texts.en: This time, Cresencia is borrowing PHP 25000 to purchase more grocery products to sell to her customers. The vegetables vending business that she previously funded through NWTF and KIVA continues to provide for Cresencia and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: buy grocery products to sell

loans.name: Celsa

texts.en:
Celsa is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Celsa  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 8  years.   Celsa requested a loan for  PHP 4,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Celsa  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Sarom, 48, lives with her husband and five children, earning a living as fish seller. She and her husband has bought and sold fish for ten years. Out of her five children, she still has one daughter who is attending school while the others help support the family's business. 

This is the first loan for Sarom with Kiva's partner VisionFund. She is requesting this loan to use to buy more fish for resale and use a portion of it to plant some spices for her family as additional income. She hopes to increase her fish business so as to better her living conditions and keep her daughter in school.

loans.use: buy fish to sell

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.   She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy more items like shampoo, laundry soap, and other grocery items to sell.

NWTF is relisting Cynthia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future for her family.

loans.use: restock her store

loans.name: Wilfredo Cristobal

texts.es:
Wilfredo, para aumentar la capacidad en el negocio solicita un nuevo préstamo e invertirlo en la compra de dos series de billetes de lotería, ya que de este negocio se ha logrado mantener por años, y siempre debe salir a ofrecer en la semana nuevas series de billete.

El mejoro la capacidad del negocio y al mismo tiempo ha recorrido nuevas zonas ofreciendo la lotería, esto le ha permitido atender bien a sus clientes y generar ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
In order to increase business capacity, Wilfredo needs a new loan to invest in the purchase of two series of lottery tickets because he’s supported himself by means of this business for years and he must go out offering new lottery series tickets weekly.  

He improved business capacity while at the same time going into new areas offering lottery tickets which has made it possible for him to provide good customer service and to generate household income.

loans.use: to buy two series of lottery numbers.

loans.name: Yuri Vanessa

texts.es:
Yuri, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo pues considera tener una mayor demanda y la necesidad para aumentar su capital de trabajo, se comprará maíz, leña, aceite, condimentos, que son necesarios para la preparación de alimentos, este préstamo ayudará para que yo continué trabajando.

Con el préstamo anterior logró mejorar la capacidad del negocio y atender un buen número de clientes, esto le ha dado la fortaleza para continuar trabajando por su familia y comenta que cuenta con un bebé de seis meses.
texts.en:
Yuri has decided on a new loan because she feels demand has grown and she needs to increase working capital.  She will buy corn, firewood, oil and condiments that are needed to prepare her dishes.  This loan will help her to stay in business.

With her previous loan she attained better business capacity and was able to tend to a good number of customers.  This has given her the strength to continue working for her family and she comments that she has a six-month-old baby.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, oil and condiments.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
Nuestra socia  es la señora  Angélica, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Asunta de Racsa” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se sigue dedicando al comercio de papas al por mayor y menor, trabajo que viene realizando hace 15  años,  Angélica realiza este sacrificado  trabajo durante todo el día, desde muy temprano en la madrugada al momento de recibir la mercadería de los productores, hasta horas de la noche que termina el movimiento comercial. Angélica se sacrifica por su familia, para ofrecerle mejor educación a sus hijos, inversión que ella considera que es  lo más importante, y algún día no muy lejano poder comprar un camión para distribuir su mercadería.
 Nuestra socia en esta oportunidad invertirá su préstamo para capitalizar su actividad y comprará diferentes especies de papas al por mayor, para cubrir su mercado y demanda.
Angélica está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse con su actividad, llevar el sustento a su casa y proporcionarles una mejor educación a sus hijos que es el gran sueño de Angelica, sacarlos profesionales , también espera que trabajando mucho y ahorrando, ella pueda adquirir un vehículo que le permita facilitar el transporte de sus productos.
texts.en:
This is our member, Angélica.  She belongs to the Virgen Asunta de Rasca Communal Bank from the city of Cusco, Peru.  She is still selling potatoes wholesale and retail, which she has been for 15 years.  Angélica does this demanding work all day long, from early in the morning when she gets her merchandise from her producers until nighttime when shopping traffic stops.  Angélica does everything she can for her family in order to offer her children  a better education, which she considers to be her most important investment.  Also, in the near future, she wants to be able to buy a truck to distribute her merchandise.

This time, our member will invest her loan in capitalizing her business and buying different kinds of potatoes wholesale to cover her market and her demand.

Angélica is very thankful to Kiva for allowing her to maintain her business, support her household, and offer her children a better education.  Angélica's greatest dream is to make her children professionals.  She also hopes that by working a lot and saving, she will be able to buy a vehicle so that she can transport her products more easily.

loans.use: to buy potatoes wholesale

loans.name: Severiano

texts.es:
El señor Severiano tiene 49 años de edad, es viudo pero tiene cinco hijos, él nació y vive en la ciudad de Oropesa a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal del socio es la elaboración de panes pero en sus horas libres se dedica a brindar servicio de taxi. 

El señor Severiano es una hombre emprendedor y trabajador que le invitaron a participar del banco Comunal “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa. En esta oportunidad el señor Severiano requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos para elaborar panes por lo tanto va comprar sacos de azúcar, sacos de harina y otras cosas más. 

El señor Severiano agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Severiano is 49 years old.  He is a widower, but he has five children.  He was born and lives in the city of Oropesa, 30 minutes from the city of Cusco.  Baking is his main business, but is offers taxi services in his free time.

Severiano is an enterprising and hardworking man who was asked to join Asociación Arariwa's Virgen Asunta de Oropesa Communal Bank.  This time, Severiano needs a loan to buy ingredients to make breads and so he will buy sacks of sugar, sacks of flour, and other things.

Severiano is thankful for the loan and he promises to make his payments on time.

loans.use: to buy sacks of sugar, sacks of flour, and other things

loans.name: Tobias

texts.en:
Tobias is 36 years old. He is separated from the wife,but supports his two children aged 16 and two years. He is a tailor and has been in the business for the past six years.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. He will use the loan amount to purchase clothing material for use in his business.

He hopes to manage to bring back his wife back home.

loans.use: Purchase clothing material.

loans.name: Julia Rita

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “INTI QUILLA”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac en la provincia y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Julia; La socia continua dedicandose a la compra y venta de artesanía y bisutería, la socia elabora lo que son muñecas artesanales,para luego venderlo a sus clientes que mas le solicitan mas que todo en el sector turismo,la socia lleva buen tiempo en este negocio el cual mediante este la socia saca adelante a su familia,la socia desea poder continuar trabajando por su familia.

La socia solicita el credito para la compra de materiales para la elaboracion de muñecas como telas de diferentes colores.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Julia is a member of the "INTI QUILLA" communal bank, which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department. 

Julia still has a business buying and selling handicrafts and jewellery. She makes traditional dolls, which she then sells to her customers. The biggest demand for her dolls comes from the tourism sector. Julia has been in this business for some time now and it has allowed her to help her family get ahead. She would like to continue working for her family.

Julia is requesting this loan to purchase materials such as coloured fabric, for making her dolls.

She is pleased to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase coloured fabric and other materials for making dolls.

loans.name: Yadis

texts.es:
En la tienda de Yadis, mujer de 32 años de edad, las amas de casa se reúnen, comparten su propia dinámica comunitaria  y compran diariamente productos de la canasta familiar,  en la cantidad que cada cual pueda pagar.  Yadis es madre de dos hijos en las edades de 9 y 15 años, que diariamente trabaja pensando justamente en su bienestar, por eso lo hace con mucho esmero e interés conservando así a su creciente clientela. 
Ella inició un negocio de tienda de ranchos, víveres, refrescos y abarrotes, hace dos años, entendiendo que debía trabajar para genera ingresos que beneficiaran su hogar, el cual solo estaba a cargo de su esposo y algunas veces no todo le salía bien  con los ingresos de su propio negocio, pues es también comerciante.  Con su tienda ha logrado ingresos para fortalecer el bienestar  de su familia y hoy  su sueño de prosperidad es ampliar su negocio, ofreciendo a su mercado todos los artículos por los cuales sus clientes preguntan y muchas veces su rotación rápida le impide responderles de manera inmediata, de igual manera vende pocos cárnicos pues no tiene una manera apropiada de refrigerarlos y tener un inventario. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará un congelador para hacer una buena refrigeración de carnes, pollo y pescado,  artículos que vende en pequeñas cantidades y quiere incrementar el volumen de sus ventas. Ella da “Gracias a Dios por abrir puertas con este negocio” y su meta a mediano plazo se concentra en comprar la vivienda donde tiene su negocio para continuar logrando bienestar para toda su familia.
texts.en:
Housewives gather together in Yadis’ store.  They share their own community dynamic and daily buy basic staple items in the amounts each can afford.  Yadis, 32, is the mother of two children who are 9 and 15 years of age who works daily with their wellbeing in mind which is why she does so with much effort and dedication thus retaining her clientele.

She started a business selling snacks, food, soft-drinks and groceries two years ago understanding that she must work to generate income to benefit her home which up to then was completely her husband’s responsibility and sometimes there wasn’t enough generated from his business; he’s a merchant too.

With her store she’s succeeded in earning income to strengthen the family’s wellbeing and today her dream for prosperity lies in expanding the business offering everything the market requires and her customers’ request.  Often, due to the fast turnover, she is unable to respond in a timely fashion to demand.  In addition, she sells few meat items because she lacks an appropriate way to refrigerate them to be able to have them in her inventory.

This is the reason why she’s calling on a Kiva loan, the first financing she gets from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy a freezer in order to keep meat, chicken and fish properly refrigerated.  These are items she currently only sells in small quantities and wants to increase sales volume of them.

She thanks God for opening doors for her by means of this business and her medium-range goal is aimed at buying the house her business is located in to continue attaining wellbeing for her entire family.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
La señora Clara tiene 54 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos, ella nació y vive en la ciudad de Oropesa a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal de la socia es la crianza de animales menores como cuyes pero también tiene una pequeña librería donde vende útiles escolares y de escritorio.   

La señora Clara es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que le invitaron a participar del banco Comunal “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa. En esta oportunidad la señora Clara requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo cuadernos, lapiceros, borradores y otras cosas más.

La señora Clara agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Clara is 54, married, and has three children. She was born in, and lives in, the town of Oropesa, 30 minutes from the city of Cusco. Her main livelihood is raising small animals such as guinea pigs, but she also has a small bookstore where she sells school and office supplies.

Clara is an enterprising and hard-working woman who was invited to participate in the “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” communal bank in Asociación Arariwa. 

On this occasion, Clara requires the loan in order to buy merchandise such as notebooks, pens, erasers and other items.

Clara appreciates the loan and promises to make her installment payments in accordance with the repayment schedule.

loans.use: To buy merchandise such as notebooks, pens, erasers and other items.

loans.name: Subhon

texts.ru:
Субхон проживает в городе Худжанд. Ему 38 лет. Субхон женат. Живет вместе с женой. У него двое детей. Жена Субхона занимается растениеводством. 
Субхон зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Он разводит скот у себя дома. Этим видом бизнеса Субхон занимается более восьми лет. Также Субхон получает прибыль от продажи молока. У Субхона 2 дойной коровы, которые каждый день дают 10 литров молока. На сегодняшний день Субхон создал все условия для разведения крупного рогатого скота. Еще у него имеется запас корма для скота. Кроме того Субхон занимается посевом сельскохозяйственных культур. 
Он берет кредит для закупа бычков.
texts.en: Subhon lives in the city of Khujand.  He is 38 years old, married, lives with his wife, and they have two children.  Subhon's wife is involved in agriculture.  Subhon earns a living by breeding cattle.  He breeds livestock at home.  Subhon has been involved in this type of business for over eight years.  He also makes a profit from selling milk.  Subhon has two dairy cows that give ten liters of milk every day.  Today, Subhon created all of the necessary conditions to breed cattle.  He also has a reserve of livestock feed.  Besides this, Subhon is involved in sowing agricultural crops.  He is requesting this loan to buy bulls.

loans.use: to buy bulls

loans.name: Aliboy

texts.ru:
Алибой житель города Худжанд. Ему 57 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Алибой занимается изготовлением мебели. Этот вид деятельности для него является семейным делом. 
Алибой более семи лет занимается изготовлением диванов, кресел, и шкафов. Он берет кредит для приобретения досок и каркаса.
texts.en: Aliboy is a resident of the city of Khujand.  He is 57 years old, married and has two children.  Aliboy is involved in making furniture.  This is a family business.  Aliboy has been involved in making couches, arm-chairs and shelves for over seven years.  He is requesting this loan to purchase wood panels and frames.

loans.use: to purchase wood panels and frames

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema lives in the Likoni area of Central Province, Kenya. She owns a cashew nuts business. Rehema started the business through her own savings. 

Rehema learnt about Milango through a friend who invited her to the group and she joined the group with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. The main challenges she faces are price fluctuations, inflation, and finding customers. 

Rehema is applying for a loan of 21,050 Kenya shillings to buy additional stock of cashew nuts. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to start a second-hand clothes business. Her future plans in five years time are to start a cereal and grocery shop.

loans.use: To buy additional stock of cashew nuts.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
La señora Yanet tiene 32 años de edad, tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos, ella nació y vive en la ciudad de Oropesa a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal de la socia Yanet es la elaboración y venta  de pan de Oropesa y ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 
  
La señora Yanet es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que le invitaron a participar del banco Comunal “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa. En esta oportunidad la señora Yanet requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo sacos de azúcar, sacos de harina y otras cosas más. 

La señora Yanet agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Yanet, 32, lives in a common law relationship and has three children.  She was born in and still lives in Oropesa that’s 30 minutes away from the city of Cusco.  Her main economic activity is baking and selling Oropesa bread; she’s been in business several years and does very well.

Yanet is an enterprising, hardworking woman who was invited to participate in Asociación Arariwa’s “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” communal bank.  On this occasion, Yanet needs the loan to buy supplies like sacks of sugar, sacks of flour and other things.  Yanet is grateful for the loan and commits to make her installment payments as scheduled.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Dinora Cecilia

texts.es:
Dinora, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo pues iniciará la siembra de pipianes, para esto necesita comprarse los insumos necesarios como el abono y los herbicidas que son los necesarios para proteger la siembra.

El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue positivo, ayudándole con el dinero para comprarse los materiales y aumentar la fertilidad en la cosecha, esta ayudandole para tener a su familia con el alimento necesario, las ganancias que le permiten cubrir los gastos, éstos le motiva a continuar trabajando a través de estos préstamos.
texts.en:
Dinora is asking for a new loan because she will start a pumpkin crop and needs to buy the necessary supplies like manure and herbicide to protect the crops.

The effect of the previous loan was positive.  It helped her with money to buy the materials and increase her harvest’s fertility.  This helped her feed her family and with profits was able to cover expenses.  This motivates her to continue working by means of these loans.

loans.use: to buy manure and pesticide.

loans.name: Fernanado

texts.es: Fernando es un joven de 28 años de edad, que cuando cumplió 21 años tuvo su experiencia de negocios de comunicaciones por internet, pero solo hasta hace 8 meses inició su propio negocio, con unos cuantos módulos donde  jóvenes clientes encuentran la forma de comunicarse mediante esta red y pueden divertirse jugando. Su negocio poco a poco creció y agregó servicios de llamadas a celulares, recargas, fotocopiaje  y la comercialización de artículos como CD, suéteres, papelería gorras y artículos que impactan a su joven clientela. Sus esfuerzos se traducen en el tiempo y calidad en el servicio que dirige a su mercado, pues abre sus instalaciones desde las 8 de la mañana y solo cierra hasta las 10 de la noche, todos los días de la semana. Sus ventas en los servicios las realiza de contado y las mercancías variada en su mayor proporción las hace a créditos, ajustados a las posibilidades de su clientela. Hace poco compró una vitrina y necesita surtirla con nueva mercancía, para aumentar su volumen de ventas y esta es justamente la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará artículos de tecnología, ropa y accesorios, como gorras y también suéteres juveniles e infantiles. Su meta mas adelante es comprar su casa, por eso no escatima los esfuerzos por generar ingresos, pues en la actualidad está casado y planea el bienestar futuro, para que cuando lleguen sus hijos al hogar tengan condiciones que le permitan ser felices y potencializar su éxito.
texts.en: Fernando is a young man of 28.  When he turned 21, he got experience in the Internet communications business, but he only started his own business eight months ago with a few modules where young customers can communicate with each other through a network and entertain themselves playing.  Little by little his business grew and he added cell phone services, phone reloading, photocopying, and merchandising articles such as CDs, sweaters, paper goods, hats, and articles that appeal to his young clientele.  His efforts are translated into the time and quality of the service he offers his market, as he opens his shop at eight in the morning and he does not close until ten at night, every day of the week.  His does his service sales in cash and most of his merchandise sales on credit, according to his customers' needs.  A little while ago, he bought a display case and he needs to stock it with new merchandise to increase his sales volume.  That is the exact reason he came to Kiva for his first financing with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use it to buy tech products, clothes, and accessories, such as hats and youth and kids' sweaters.  His goal for the future is to buy a house, which is why he is not skimping on his efforts to generate income, as he is currently married and he is planning for his future well-being so that when he has children they will have the conditions they needs to be happy and make them successful.

loans.use: to buy tech items, clothing, and accessories, such as hats and youth and kids' sweaters

loans.name: Jose Gilberto

texts.es:
José, está solicitando prestamo ya que considera que son un recurso muy importante para el crecimiento del negocio, se comprara una variedad de calzado para niños y adultos, incluyendo sandalias de diferentes estilos, esta inversión le dara el crecimiento en el mercado y la disponibilidad para atender las demandas de los clientes.

Con el préstamo anterior logró mejorar la calidad del negocio y mejorar también la mercadería a los clientes, esto le ha dado una mejor oportunidad para generar ingresos y para atraer nuevos clientes, él está motivado a seguir trabajando por la prosperidad en su familia.
texts.en:
José is requesting a loan, as he considers these a very important resource for achieving growth in his business. He will buy a variety of footwear for children and adults, including sandals of various styles. This investment will give him growth in his market and his selection, so that he can meet customer demand.

With the previous loan, he succeeded in improving the quality of his store, and in improving the merchandise he offers customers. This has given him a better opportunity to generate income and attract new customers. He is motivated to continue working for the sake of his family's prosperity.

loans.use: To buy footwear for children and adults.

loans.name: Collanas Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario collanas está constituído por tres personas que buscan un mismo fin que es el de triunfar y sacar adelante a su familia. En este grupo la presidenta es Silvia debido a que es una persona sencilla, humilde, respetuosa y colaboradora. En la fotografía Silvia es la chica de saco lila.

Silvia trabaja con su esposo y otros familiares en la crianza de vacas lecheras, en este negocio estan tres años, antes Silvia se dedicaba a cuidar los animalitos de su mamá pero poco a poco ha ido comprando sus propias vacas y se puede dedicar a la producción de leche. Como en todo negocio la clientela aumenta Silvia necesita incrementar su producción, es por eso que solicitó un crédito a Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser invertido para la compra de una vaca lechera para incrementar la producción de leche.

Silvia sueña que su familia siga unida, que mejore su calidad de vida y pronto poder construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
The Collanas communal bank is comprised of three people who are looking for the same outcome, which is to triumph and to get their families’ ahead.  Silvia is the president of this group because she is an unpretentious, humble, respectful, and cooperative person.  Silvia is the girl in the picture with the lilac jacket.

Silvia works with her husband and other family members raising dairy cows.  She has been in this business for three years.  Before that Silvia took care of her mother’s animals.  However, little by little, she has been buying her own cows, and she is able to devote herself to milk production.

Like in all businesses, the clientele is increasing.  Silvia needs to increase her production.  That is why she requested a loan from Fodemi.  She will use the loan to buy a dairy cow in order to increase the milk production.

Silvia dreams that her family continues to be united, that her quality of life improves, and that she will soon be able to build her own house.

loans.use: tp buy a dairy cow in order to increase milk production.

loans.name: Alexandra

texts.es: Alexandra con sus 3 años de haber iniciado su negocio de venta de gafas, relojes, accesorios y gorros ha logrado aumentar sus ingresos, los cuales unidos a los de su esposo benefician su hogar y cimientan un futuro prometedor, para los hijos que han de llegar.. Su mejoramiento se ve reflejado en la construcción de su propio local, donde ofrece de contado, su mercancía directamente al consumidor final. Con su venta al detalle, ha logrado construir una abundante clientela alrededor del barrio donde habita y tiene su negocio.   Alexandra realiza las compras por lotes, para conseguir mejores precios y llevar la mercancía al mercado, con la  posibilidad de ser cada vez más competitiva. Su negocio tiene un potencial de crecimiento importante, debido a que ofrece con sus productos, la confianza que su clientela quiere encontrar y esto hace que todo lo que ella exhiba, responda a las preferencias de sus compradores. Hoy se a acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para solicitar un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación, mediante el cual comprará accesorios femeninos, fantasía y una vitrina,  para exhibirla de manera elegante; con ella   espera impactar a su clientela y hacerla rotar, para ganar cada vez mas dinero y esto es justamente lo que hace que su credikiva tenga el éxito esperado y que el sueño de prosperidad de Alexandra y su esposo sea logrado gradualmente.
texts.en:
Alexandra started her business selling sunglasses, watches, accessories and caps three years ago and has succeeded in increasing her income which when added to her husband’s benefits her home and insures a promising future for their children that are to come.  Her improvement is reflected in the construction of her own locale where she sells her merchandise for cash directly to the final consumer.  With her retail sales she’s managed to build a large clientele in the neighborhood where she lives and has her store.

Alexandra buys by lots in order to get better prices and take merchandise to the marketplace thus becoming more competitive each time.  Her business has important growth potential because she offers alongside her products the confidence that her customers will be able to find what they want and this causes her to display what her customers’ request.

She has approached Fundación Mario Santo Domingo today to request a Kiva loan, her first financing with the Fundación, to buy women’s accessories, costume jewelry and a display case to display them elegantly.  She hopes to make an impression on her customers this way and sell everything in order to earn more money which is why we at the Fundación believe her Kiva loan will be successful hoping that Alexandra’s and her husband’s dream of prosperity will gradually be attained.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and a display case.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a printing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy the materials needed for her printing business.

Erma has been in this business for 15 years. Erma earns more income from selling frozen foods.

Erma has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to buy a new printing machine for her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy the materials needed for her printing business

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is 40 years old and married with 3 children.

Evangeline is in the agricultural business and raises pigs in the Philippines. Evangeline has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Evangeline has been raising pigs for 11 years now, and she has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF, and more recently from Kiva, to sustain it.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business and to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ilda Elsa

texts.es: La Sra. Ilda de 50 años de edad es casada y tiene dos hijos ella es dueña de una miscelánea y esposo se dedica a la venta de refrescos. Los dos tienen negocios propios y esto es de gran ejemplo para sus hijos porque demuestra la determiacion y entusiasmo que tienen sus padres. En esta ocasión Ilda pide de nuestra ayuda para la compra de mercancía para reabastecer su negocio ella quiere darse a conocer y expandir su negocio. Es una persona muy responsable y confiable es por eso que sus clientes son fieles con ella y con su ngocio.
texts.en:
Ilda is 50, married, and has two children. She owns a convenience store, and her husband sells soft drinks. Both of them have their own businesses, and this is a great example for their children, because it demonstrates the determination and enthusiasm that their parents have.

On this occasion, Ilda is asking for our help to buy merchandise for restocking her store. She wants to make a name for herself and expand her business. She is a very responsible and reliable person, and that is why her customers are loyal to her and her business.

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Nancy Lorena

texts.es: Fueron muchos los artículos que compró Nancy con su credikiva anterior: ropa, electrodomésticos menores y mucha bisutería. Ella está muy contenta porque  aumentó el volumen de sus ventas a crédito y rotó rápidamente su mercancía. Hoy quiere continuar apoyándose en su credikiva y está aplicando a un nuevo financiamiento, mediante le cual comprará calzado, lociones y cosméticos, productos con los que no ha incursionado en el mercado y con los que va a diversificar su oferta basándose en la preventa que ha realizado. Ella da las gracias a Kiva por su apoyo y le apuntamos a que su inversión sea igualmente exitosa como la anterior, pues ella es una mujer que busca el bienestar de su familia trabajando persistentemente, al lado de su cónyuge.
texts.en:
Nancy bought many items with her previous Kiva loan:  clothes, small home appliances and much costume jewelry.  She’s very happy because her credit sales volume increased and her merchandise turned over quickly.  

Today she wants to continue helping herself out with a Kiva loan and is applying for a new one by means of which she’ll buy footwear, lotions and cosmetics, products she’s not yet introduced into her market and with which she will diversify her offer based on prior orders she’s received.

She thanks Kiva for its support and we at the Fundación are betting that her investment will be equally successful as the previous one was because she’s a woman who seeks her family’s wellbeing by working persistently alongside her spouse.

loans.use: to buy footwear, lotion and cosmetics.

loans.name: Esterlita

texts.en:
Esterlita works hard to support her family. Esterlita is married and has a food production business in the Philippines.

Esterlita has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Esterlita has been in this business for 5 years now, and she also earns additional income from selling clothing.

In the future, Esterlita would like to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Fermina

texts.en:
Fermina is 52 years old and married with seven children.  With two children in school, Fermina works very hard to provide for them.

Fermina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Fermina has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries. 

In the future, Fermina would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Marleni

texts.es:
La señora Marleni tiene 44 años de edad, es casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos, ella nació en a la ciudad de Huarcapay pero actualmente vive en la ciudad de Oropesa a 30 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. Su actividad económica principal de la socia es la elaboración de pan. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 

La señora Marleni es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que le invitaron a participar del banco Comunal “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” de la Asociación Arariwa. En esta oportunidad la señora Marleni requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de azúcar, sacos de harina y otras cosas más. 

La señora Marleni agradece el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas de acuerdo al cronograma de pagos.
texts.en:
Marleni is 44, married and has three children. She was born in the city of Huarcapay but now she lives in the city of Oropesa, 30 minutes from Cusco. 

Her main economic activity is making bread. She has worked in this sector for several years already and things are going well for her.

Marleni is an entrepreneurial, hardworking woman. She was invited to join the communal bank “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” by the Asociación Arariwa. She needs a loan to buy supplies such as sacks of sugar and sacks of flour, among other things.

Marleni is grateful for the loan and pledges to repay it on time.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as sacks of sugar and sacks of flour, among other things.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To maintain his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Anatolyi

texts.ru:
Анатолий – из Белой Церкви, Центральная Украина. Он зарабатывает на жизнь, предоставляя маршрутные перевозки пассажиров по городу на арендованном бусе. У Анатолия есть свой маршрут, на котором он работает. Его валовый доход составляет 12 000 гривен. Чистая прибыль – около 6 000 гривен. 

Анатолию необходимы дополнительные средства в размере 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы выкупить бус марки Мерседес 208 Спринтер для последующей работы на нем в городе. Кроме работы на маршрутном бусе, Анатолий любит возиться с техникой: он выкупает старые автомобили, ремонтирует их и перепродает по более высокой цене, тем самым принося в семью дополнительный заработок.
texts.en: Anatolyi is from Belaya Tserkov, Central Ukraine.  He earns a living by providing a passenger transportation service within the city on a leased mini-bus.  Anatolyi has his own route that he works on.  His gross income is 12,000 hryvnia.  His net profit is about 6,000 hryvnia.  Anatolyi needs additional money in the amount of 20,000 hryvnia in order to buy out the mini-bus Mercedes 208 Sprinter for subsequent work in the city.  Besides working on a mini-bus, Anatolyi loves to work with technology: he buys old cars, repairs them and resells them at a higher price; thus, earning an additional income for the family.

loans.use: to buy out a mini-bus Mercedes 208 Sprinter for subsequent work use

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.ru:
Rovshan yavlyayetsya IDP personom, on pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda seychas projivayet v Baku regione vmeste so svoyey semyoy. Rovshan ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. On rodilsya 1987 qodu. Rovshan uje 3 qoda kak zanimayetsya transportirovkoy gruzov, v osnovnom eto bivayet mebel. Rovshan seychas nujdayetsya v 1600, tak kak yemu ochen srochno nujno zamenit kolosa svoyey mashini chtobi on smog prodoljit svoyu rabotu. 
Rovshan xochet razvit svoy bizness i v budushem zamenit svoyu mashinu na bole bolshuyu dlya razmesheniya bolshe gruza.
texts.en: Rovshan is an IDP from the city of Fuzuli and now lives in the Baku region together with his family.  He is not married and does not have children.  He was born in 1987.  Rovshan has been involved in transporting freight, primarily furniture, for three years.  Currently, he needs 1600 AZN to urgently change tires on his vehicle in order to continue his work.  Rovshan wants to develop his business and will replace his vehicle with a larger one to fit more freight in the future.

loans.use: to purchase new tires for his vehicle

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is forty years old, single, with four children. She has operated a cyber café business for the last ten years, earning a monthly income of KES 50,000. 

She has applied for her first loan of KES.30,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to purchase one more  computer for the work. With the anticipated profit, she plans to open another cyber cafe. Her hope for the future is to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase one more  computer.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is 57 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 19,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more grocery products like soft drinks, canned goods, etc. to sell.

Bernardita has been in this business for seven years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products like soft drinks, canned goods, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es:
El socio se dedica al negocio de transporte,el socio tiene un carro que hace servicio de taxi,el socio trabaja desde las 9:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,en algunas oportunidades el socio se queda hasta las 11:00 p.m o 12:00 p.m haciendo servicio de taxi en las diferentes calles de la ciudad de Cusco,el sueño del socio es comprarse un carro nuevo,el socio ya tiene 5 años en este negocio de servicio de taxi donde ha conocido muchas personas.El socio solicita el credito para comprar repuestos para su carro y tambien comprar llantas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Rodolfo works in the transport sector. He owns a car, with which he provides a taxi service, working from 9 am to 7 pm. Occasionally he works as late as 11 pm or 12 pm , driving passengers around the streets of Cusco. 

Rodolfo’s dream is to buy a new car. He has been in this business for five years already and has met a lot of people through his work. He is applying for a loan so that he can buy spare parts and tires for his car.

Rodolfo is pleased to be receiving the loan and pledges to repay it on time.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and tires for his taxi.

loans.name: Marhabo

texts.ru:
Мархабо родилась 1951 году. Вдова, имеет одного ребенка. Ее сын работает таксистом. Невестка Мархабо вместе с ней занимается шитьем. 
Мархабо портниха. Она более десяти лет занимается шитьем. Мархабо принимает заказы на дому. Кроме того она шьет национальные платья для продажи. Таким образом она получает не плохую прибыль. 
Мархабо берет кредит для приобретения швейной машинки специально для вышивки. Также она хочет отремонтировать свой дом.
texts.en: Marhabo was born in 1951.  She is a widow and has one child.  Her son works as a taxi driver.  Marhabo's daughter-in-law and Marhabo are involved in sewing.  Marhabo is a seamstress.  She has been involved in sewing for over ten years.  Marhabo accepts her work orders at home.  Besides this, she sews national dresses for sale.  This is how she earns a decent profit.  Marhabo is requesting this loan to purchase a sewing machine specifically for embroidery.  She also wants to repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine and repair her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Mehmonkhuja

texts.ru: Мехмонхуча живет в городе Худжанд. Ему 49 лет. Он женат, имеет двоих детей. Его супруга домохозяйка, а сын работает водителем. Его сын предоставляет услугу. Сам Мехмонхуча занимается перевозками на своем грузовом автомобиле и с чувством ответственности занимается этим видом деятельности. Он хочет расширить свою деятельность. Кредит просит для приобретения еще одного грузового автомобиля Спринтер. Он намерен дать автомобиль в аренду и помогать людям, которые не в состоянии приобрести машину, также получать дополнительную прибыль.
texts.en: Mehmonkhuja lives in the city of Khujand.  He is 49 years old, married and has two children.  His wife is a homemaker, and son works as a driver and provides a service.  Mehmonkhuja is involved in transportation, using his heavy-duty truck, and does this work with a sense of responsibility.  He wants to expand his business.  He is requesting this loan to purchase another heavy-duty truck Sprinter.  Mehmonkhuja intends to lease this vehicle and help people, who are unable to purchase a vehicle, and to make an additional profit.

loans.use: to purchase a a heavy-duty truck

loans.name: Ilkham

texts.ru: Ilkam rabotayet masterom uje 7 let. On etoy rabote nauchilsya u svoyego otca ranshe on vse vremya pomogal yemu v rabote no potom nachal rabotat samostoyatelno. Ilkham nujna ssuda s summoy v 1500 AZN chtobi on smog kupit instrumenti ,elektricheskiye oborudivaniye kotoroye bivayet nujno v yego rabote. On ochen trudolubiviy chelovek kotoriy ochen lubit svoyu semyu i mnogo raboteyet chtobi obespechit ix. Ilkham 38 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Jivut oni v Baku regione.
texts.en: Ilkham has been working as a repairman for seven years.  He learned this work from his father and used to always help him with work, but then started to work independently.  Ilkham needs a loan in the amount of 1500 AZN to purchase tools and electric equipment, which will be needed for his work.  He is a hardworking person, who loves his family very much and works a lot to provide for them.  Ilkham is 38 years old, married and has two children.  They live in the Baku region.

loans.use: to purchase tools for his work

loans.name: Mirmahmud

texts.ru:
Мирмахмуд житель города Худжанд. Он жена. Ему 31 год. У него двое детей. Мирмахмуд имеет среднее образование. 
Мирмахмуд предоставляет услугу. Он имеет не большую столовую (ошхона), где работает поваром. В этой области Мирмахмуд сем лет. Мирмахмуд просит кредит для приобретения автомобиля, чтобы привозить продукты.
texts.en: Mirmahmud is a resident of the city of Khujand.  He is 31 years old, married and has two children.  Mirmahmud has a secondary education.  He provides a service.  He has a small cafe (oshkhon), where he works as a cook.  Mirmahmud has been in this business for seven years.  He is requesting this loan to purchase a car in order to deliver products.

loans.use: to purchase a car

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 53 years old, married, and has four children. 

Gloria is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Gloria has been hog-raising for 10 years now and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gloria would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria del Carmen  casada, con 40  años de edad con actividad economica comerciante  con dos hijos  menores de edad , ha demostrada su responsabilidad, muy trabajora, emprendedora  esta solicitando el credito para las mejoras de su vivienda y embaldosar una parte de la vivienda ya que tiene cinco años de haberla comprado, pero por falta de capital  no habia podido realizar la mejoras necesaria para la estabilidad y proteccion de su familia , el financiamiento lo invertira en la compra de material para contruir como: zinc, alfajillas, cementos, madera, clavadores entre otros.
texts.en: Mariela del Carmen is 40 years old, she is married and she has 2 children that are minors. She is a retailer, and she has proven herself to be a responsible, very hard-working and resourceful person. She is requesting a loan to make improvements to her house and to install tile flooring in a part of her house: she bought it 5 years ago but she hasn’t been able to make the improvements needed to grant stability and protection to her family because she did not have enough money. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of construction materials such as zinc, lumber, cement, wood, nail-drivers and other materials.

loans.use: To buy zinc, lumber, cement, wood and nail-drivers.

loans.name: Iskra Tamara

texts.es: Iskra Tamara de  27 años ,casada del municipio de Chinandega, con tres hijos menores de edad tiene por actividad económica la venta de comida experiencia en el negocio 4 años, este emprendedor tiene inicio con esta herramienta de trabajo para tener un medio de cómo sacar adelante  a sus hijos, Iskra ha tenido otros préstamos con fundación león  2000, el cual ha demostrado ser responsable, trabajadora, de buenas costumbre , con ganas de superación , en la actualidad está solicitando el financiamiento para compra productos de consumo para elaboración de comidas como: arroz, frijoles, carnes, de res, pollo, verduras, condimentos entre otros.
texts.en: Iskra Tamara is 27 years old, married, and lives in the town of Chinandega with her three dependent children.  Her business is selling food.  She has four years experience in this business.  This entrepreneur started her business as she needed a way of providing for her children.  Iskra has received previous loans from Fundación León 2000.  She has shown herself to be responsible, hard-working, well-mannered, and has a desire to do well in life.  She is currently requesting a loan to buy supplies she needs for making food such as rice, beans, beef, chicken, vegetables, seasonings, etc.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, beef, pork, vegetables, seasonings, etc.

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es: Juana Antonia,   de 55 años, casada, tiene por actividad economica venta de mercaderia en general, tiene 14 años de experiencia, el cual lo tiene ubicado de forma ambulante, juana antonia se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer responsable, trabajadora, con solvencia de pagos, en la actualidad el financiamiento lo quiere para invertir en el negocio como: pantalones, camisas, shorts, faldas, vestidos, camisetas entre otros.
texts.en: Juana Antonia is 55 years old, she is married, she is a street vendor who sells various products and she has a 14-years’ experience in the field. Juana Antonia has proven herself to be a responsible and hardworking woman who is solvent in her payments. She is currently requesting a loan to investing it in her activity by purchasing trousers, shirts, shorts, skirts, dresses, T-shirts and other products.

loans.use: To buy trousers, shirts, shorts, skirts, dresses and T-shirts.l

loans.name: Maria Graciela

texts.es: Maria Graciela de 57 años de edad, casada,  tiene por actividad economica la venta de celulares ubicado en su casa de habitacion desde hace 5 años,  herramienta de trabajo que inicio para tener un medio mas de ingresos, Maria graciela ya ha tenido varios creditos con fundacion lo cual ha demostrado responsabilidad, ganas de superacion y , en la actualidad ella esta solicitando el fianciamiento para invertir en su pequeño negocio como: comprar celulares, tiempo aire, cordones colgantes, chit, carcasas, cartucheras, entre otros.
texts.en: Maria Graciela is 57 years old, she is married and she has been selling mobile phones from her house for 5 years, an activity she has started to earn more money. Maria Graciela has already received various loans from our Fundación, proving herself to be responsible and to have a great desire to progress. She is currently requesting a loan to invest it in her small activity by buying mobile phones, air time for calling cards, mobile strings, cell phone coupons, phone covers, phone cases and other products.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones, air time for calling cards, mobile strings, cell phone coupons, phone covers, phone cases and other products.

loans.name: Maria  De Los Milagros

texts.es: Maria de 38 años de edad vive en el municipio de San Jun Nepomuceno y sus tres hijos en las edades de 15 a 21 años. Allí tiene un  negocio con el que genera los ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar, pues ofrece en su propia casa el servicio de internet, fotocopiaje  y lo combina perfectamente con la venta de ropa en la línea femenina. Su negocio nació como iniciativa de un amigo, cuando después de estar muy enferma y habiendo vendido su anterior negocio, la orientó hacia la tecnología de la comunicación, por eso con el dinero producto de la venta realizada, compró computadores los instaló y una vez recuperada en su salud,  inició su tarea comercial de este servicio. Diariamente tiene sus propias metas de venta, que se combinan con los muchos deseos de crecer y aumentar sus ingresos. Durante sus 10 años de experiencia en la venta de telas, logró construir una clientela que hoy quiere reactivar haciéndole una oferta tentadora, en la línea de ropa femenina, mediante crédito otorgado, para que estos paguen en plazos pactados y a su vez ajustados a sus posibilidades. Su mayor desafío es no tener el capital de trabajo suficiente, para invertir y esta es justamente la razón por la cual se acerca a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante la cual comprará, accesorios para computadores,  ropa para damas en mayor volumen y a la moda, con esta inversión aspira a incrementar sus ventas a crédito y poco a poco logrará el crecimiento de su negocio, para alcanzar su propósito de prosperidad que no es otra cosa que ver a sus hijo convertidos en  profesionales de prestigio y esta si que es la razón de éxito de su credikiva.
texts.en:
Maria is 38 years old and lives in the city of San Jun Nepomuceno with her three children who range in ages from 15 to 21 years.  She has a business there; offering internet and photocopy services, where she generates the income she needs to support her household.  She combines these businesses perfectly with selling a line of ladies’ clothing.  Her business was born though the initiative of a friend, who taught her about communication technology and who sold her previous business after becoming very ill.  She used the money to buy and install computers and began offering this service after recovering her health.

She has her own personal daily sales goals that fit into her many desires to grow and increase her income.  During her 10 years of selling fabrics, she was able to build a customer base that she now wants to reestablish by making her customers a tempting offer related to women’s clothing, by offering them credit so that they can make payments they can afford.  Her greatest challenge is not having enough working capital to invest, so for this reason she approached Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will buy computer accessories and in style women’s clothing in quantity.  This investment will allow her to increase her credit sales and little by little she will be able to grow her business and her achieve goals of prosperity, which include seeing her children become prestigious professionals.  This will be the reason for the success of her Kiva loan.

loans.use: to buy computer accessories and women's clothing.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
Con un préstamo de 10,600 pesos Elisa podrá comprar mercancía tales como jamón, queso, pan, mantequilla, huevos, frutas para los jugos para poder servir a un mayor número de clientes. Elisa tiene una cafetería en la que prepara desayunos todos los días para sus clientes. Hace 1 año que inició en este negocio y este ha ido creciendo poco a poco. Elisa es madre soltera, su niño tiene 4 años y está en una escuela preescolar. 
Elisa desea que su negocio crezca, para poder asegura la manutención y los estudios de su niño. "Mi niño es mi razón de ser, el motivo por el que cada día me levanto con la intensión de trabajar duro para asegurale un mejor futuro"
texts.en:
Thanks to a loan of 10,600 pesos Elisa will be able to buy more products such as ham, cheese, bread, butter, eggs and fruits in order to serve a larger number of customers. Elisa runs a café, and she prepares breakfast meals for her customers every day. It has been a year since she started this activity and it has been growing little by little. Elisa is a single mother, her son is 4 years old and he goes to kindergarten.
Elisa wants her activity to grow in order to be able to provide for her child and to pay for his education. She said “My son is who I live for, the reason I get up every day wanting to work hard in order to grant him a better future”.

loans.use: Comprar mercancía para su cafetería

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 27 years old and married. He and his wife are blessed with two children whom they support. He has operated a business raising pigs for the last ten years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 10,000 from KADET LTD, which he plans to use to purchase more piglets to rear for sale later. 

He will invest the anticipated profits back into his business. His future plan is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to purchase to more piglets.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 53 years old, married, and has 6 children, 2 of whom attend school.

Lucia is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Lucia requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lucia has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 23 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lucia would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Marylou

texts.en:
Marylou is 54 years old and married with 9 children. With 3 children in school, Marylou works very hard to provide for them.

Marylou runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items to sell.

Marylou has been in this business for 11 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, eggs, coffee, and other groceries. 

In the future Marylou would like to save enough money that she can continue to send her children to college and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Taciana

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Taciana works hard to support her family.

She has a tailoring business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from general store. Taciana is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy more fabric clothing and other materials for her business.

Taciana has been sustaining her business activities through her past 9 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more fabric clothing and other materials for her business.

loans.name: Elsa Marina

texts.es:
Elsa tiene 51 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos con edades entre 10 a 30  años, vive con su familia en la aldea Suyapa de Santa Cruz de Yojoa.
Elsa Marina, trabajaba como cajera en una empresa privada, ha sido una mujer trabajadora  y sola ha podido sacar sus hijos adelante, hace 18 años logro establecer con sus propios fondos un negocio de venta de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos y útiles escolares. Ella atiende su negocio desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche.
Doña Elsa es una excelente cliente de Odef una señora muy trabajadora y responsable, en el mes de Enero solicito el préstamo numero 19 de 15,000 lempiras y lo invirtió en la compra de útiles escolares, como cuadernos, lapices, colores, sacapuntas, mochilas y uniformes. Con esta inversión pudo superar las ventas y logro obtener buenas ganancias con las cuales pudo pagar el préstamo. Motivada a que su negocio ha crecido mucho ha solicitado actualmente el préstamo numero 20 de 18,000 lempiras y lo necesita para la comprar variedad de calzado, para cubrir la demanda de pedidos que tiene de los clientes.
Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio y tener el capital necesario para hacer mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Elsa, age 51, is a single mother of four children between the ages of 10 and 30.  She lives with her family in the neighborhood of Suyapa in Santa Cruz de Yojoa.

Elsa Marina works as a cashier at a private company. Being a hardworking woman, she has been able to help her children move forward. Eighteen years ago, she used her own funds to establish a business where she sells clothes, shoes, cosmetics, and school supplies. She manages her business between 7 A.M. and 8 P.M. 

Doña Elsa is an excellent client of ODEF as well as a hardworking and responsible woman.  In the month of January, she requested her 19th loan in the amount of 15,000 HNL and invested it in the purchase of school supplies such as notebooks, pencils, crayons, pencil sharpeners, backpacks, and uniforms.  With this investment, she was able to surpass her sales and obtain good earnings which she used to repay her loan.  Motivated to grow her business even more, she is now requesting her 20th loan in the amount of 18,000 HNL which she needs to buy a variety of shoes so that she can meet the demand as a result of the orders submitted by her customers.  

Her goal is to continue growing her business and have the necessary capital to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy a variety of shoes.

location.town: Aldea Suyapa, Santa Cruz de Yojoa

loans.name: Tres Caminos I Group

texts.es:
El Sr. Pedro,  tiene 48 años de edad, esta casado, vive junto con su esposa y sus hijos en una aldea del Municipio de la Esperanza, Intibucá.
Don Pedro se ha dedicado siempre a la agricultura, cultiva papa, habichuela y frijol para la venta. La zona donde el vive es apta para los cultivos,  los 35 años que tiene dedicándose a esta actividad con una gran experiencia y conocimiento los cuales le han permitido los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia. La producción que saca la vende en el mercado municipal.
Esta solicitando un crédito de 7,000 lempiras con el cual comprara fertilizantes, insumos y semillas de papa y de habichuela para el cultivo y darle la asistencia al mismo. 
Su meta es seguir trabajando para seguir mejorando sus cultivos y así mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
El pertenece al Grupo Solidario que se llama  Tres Caminos I,  que esta formado por 13 integrantes que viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican también a al agricultura. En la foto se identifican de la manera siguiente: A la izquierda esta Doña  Belinda, seguido Doña Maria Julia, Ma. Margarita, Felicita, Justino, José, Pedro, Maria Abelina, Juana, Pablo y a la derecha Doña Maria Francisca. Dos de ellos no aparecen en la foto.
texts.en:
Pedro is 48 years old and married.  He lives with his wife and children in a village in the Esperanza municipality in Intibucá.

Pedro has always been a farmer.  He grows potatoes, green beans, and kidney beans to sell.  The area where he lives is suitable for the crops.  He has been doing this for 35 years.  He has a lot of experience and knowledge, which have allowed him the income he needs to support his family.  He sells the production that he gets at the local market. 

He is requesting a loan for 7,000 lempiras.  He will use the loan to buy fertilizers, supplies, and potato and bean seeds to care for his crops.  His goal is to continue working in order to continue improving his crops.  This way he will improve his family’s living conditions.

He belongs to the Tres Caminos I communal bank.  The group is comprised of 13 member who live in the same community and are also farmers.  They appear in the photo from left to right:  Belinda, Maria Julia, Maria Margarita, Felicita, Justino, José, Pedro, Maria Abelina, Juana, Palblo, and Maria Francisca.  Two members do not appear in the photo.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, supplies, and potato and bean seeds for his crops.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia is 59 years old and married with 5 children.

Alicia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a firewood retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Alicia has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the firewood retail business for 2 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Alicia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell.

loans.name: Bessie

texts.en:
Bessie is 47 years old and married with one child.

Bessie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.
