Bessie has borrowed and paid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 25 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Bessie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy additional stock of fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

Esther has been in this business for 13 years. Esther earns more income from food vending.

Esther has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of fish to sell.

loans.name: Rubie

texts.en:
Rubie is 18 years old, single, and lives in the Philippines.
Rubie is a gasoline boy in a private gasoline store. He also sells menswear like underwear and shorts. He has had this business for 2 years. He requested a loan for 4,000 PHP to purchase more menswear to re-sell.
Rubie has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Rubie hopes to improve his business so he can continue his studies.

loans.use: to purchase menswear to re-sell.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is 29 years old and married with 2 children.

Jenelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., in her general store.

Jenelyn has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and tomatoes.

Jenelyn aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Jenita

texts.en:
Jenita is 50 years old and married with 3 children.

She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Jenita is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds for her pigs.

Jenita has been fattening pigs for 5 years and also earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Amor

texts.en:
Amor works hard to support 2 children. She is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Amor has requested a PHP 1,400 loan through NWTF to buy an Envirofit Charcoal Stove.

She is getting the Envirofit Charcoal Stove, because she wants to lessen the amount of charcoal that she uses when cooking food for her family.

Amor is aware that by using the Envirofit Charcoal Stove, she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To buy an Envirofit Charcoal Stove

loans.name: Jercita

texts.en:
As a married parent of 3 children, Jercita works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Jercita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

Jercita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 7 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her restaurant business.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 30 years old and married with one child who is in school Maricel works very hard to provide for them.

Maricel runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Maricel has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, sugar, bread, soft drinks, etc.

In the future, Maricel would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Melodia

texts.en:
Melodia is 51 years old and married with 8 children.

Melodia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a peanut retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of peanuts to sell.

Melodia has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the peanut retail business for 10 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and rice and raising pigs.

Melodia aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of peanuts to sell.

loans.name: Rizah Mae

texts.en:
Rizah Mae is 29 years old and married with one child.

Rizah Mae works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,500 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

Rizah Mae has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Rizah Mae aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Josephine has been in this business for 15 years. Josephine earns more income from pig-fattening and food-vending.

Josephine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Selda

texts.en:
Selda is 49 years old, married and has three children. For the past seven years she has sold beauty products from her shop like face cream, body lotion and makeup.

Selda has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. She is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to buy more beauty products to sell. She hopes to improve her business so she can continue educating her children.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products to sell.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 39 years old and married with four children. For the past four years she has earned a living by buying and selling livestock. She also earns additional income through her sari-sari (general store).

Grace is borrowing 19,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise and sell. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy additional livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es: María Josefa, tiene la edad  de 43 años, está casada,  vive con sus cuatro hijos y el esposo actualmente. Ella con el crédito pretende comprar tela para hacer ropa interior para hombre y de mujer para revenderla y también piyamas . Ella tiene pensado comprar  tela al por mayor para que le sea más cómodo y obtener más ganancias y poder vender la mercancía en el mercado de la localidad y alrededores,  para obtener buenas ganancias y una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: María Josefa is 43 years old and lives with her husband and four children.  With this loan she intends to buy cloth so that she can make pajamas and underwear for men and women for resale.  She plans to buy the cloth wholesale as this will make it easier to obtain a greater profit.  She will sell the merchandise in her local market and surrounding areas so that she can make good income and achieve a more stable, higher quality of life.  This is her first loan from FUDECOSUR.  She has not taken other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has made it easier to obtain a loan, and their interest rate is much lower.

loans.use: to buy cloth.

loans.name: Jefferson

texts.es: Con su credikiva Jefferson compró de todo un poco, ropa, articulos de belleza, cosméticos, papelería y accesorios femeninos, que vendió muy rapidamente, tambien logró ampliar su negocio y ubicar un local en un lugar contiguo a su vivienda. Hoy se propone a  acceder a un nuevo credikiva, porque quiere impulsar una vez mas sus ventas y generar ingresos para aumentar  cada vez mas biesnestar a su hogar.Se propone comprar con este financiamiento productos de papelería y de miscelanea en general, pues ahora en su local exhibirá los articulos en un lugar visible que impactará a sus clientes y despertará su atención el ninterés , el deseo y la acción de comp´ra. El se encuentra muy agradecido con los finaciadores de Kiva, por este gran apoyo que le han dado, pues justamente impacta positivamente el bienestar de su familia tambien.
texts.en:
With his previous loan, Jefferson bought a little of everything - clothes, beauty supplies, cosmetics, stationary and women's accessories.  He sold these items very quickly and was also able to expand his business, establishing a shop next to his home.

He is now applying for a new loan, since he wants to increase his sales and generate income to continue to improve the well-being of his household.  With this loan he intends to buy paper and stationary products, as well as miscellaneous merchandise.  He is now able to exhibit his merchandise so that he can capture his customers' interest in his products so that they will be able to buy more of his goods.

He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for the great deal of support they have given him so that he can have a positive impact on the well-being of his family.

loans.use: to buy paper and stationary products, as well as miscellaneous merchandise.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
As a married parent of 8 children, Sherlita works hard to support her family.

She has a business weaving nipa (woven palm mat used for the repair/construction of houses) in the Philippines and also earns income from running a general store and raising ducks. Sherlita is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional raw materials for her business for her nipa-weaving business.

Sherlita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional raw materials for her business.

loans.name: Pretty

texts.en:
Pretty is 41 years old and married with 4 children.

Pretty works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Pretty has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from raising pigs and selling peanuts.

Pretty aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Arlie

texts.en: For her ninth cycle loan, Arlie is borrowing PHP 29,000 to fund her wholesale and retail sales of soft drinks. The Internet cafe business that she previously funded through KIVA and NWTF continues to provide for Arlie and her family with income that is improving their standard of living.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of soft drinks to sell to customers.

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
This is 38 year-old Lawrence. He is married and has four children aged fourteen, eleven, eight and five.

In 2008 Lawrence established his furniture business. He began work in this trade because he wanted to earn a living after leaving school and this was his only viable source of income. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about 580,000 SLL every month.

Lawrence is applying for a 3,000,000 SLL loan in order to buy timber, nails, furniture polish and chair materials. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 320,000 SLL.

In the future, Lawrence plans to improve his workshop, to develop his plot of land and to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy timber, nails, furniture polish and chair materials.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee works hard to support her family. Haydee is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Haydee is borrowing PHP 1,400 through NWTF to buy an Envirofit charcoal stove.

She is getting the Envirofit charcoal stove because she wants to lessen the amount of charcoal that she uses when cooking food for her family.

Haydee is aware that by using the envirofit charcoal stove, she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing health risks and hazards to her family.

loans.use: to purchase an Envirofit charcoal stove.

loans.name: Karen Johanna

texts.es:
Karen, tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene un hijo, vive en el municipio de las vegas Santa Bárbara junto a sus padres y su hijo.
Ella tiene su propio negocio desde hace 2 años donde vende productos alimenticios como arroz, frijoles, lácteos, carnes, pan, churros  etc. este negocio es su única fuente de ingresos y lo ha mantenido estable por su buena administración y la reinversión de utilidades. Esta solicitando un préstamo por 12,000 Lempiras para comprar productos que no tiene y que demandan los clientes, así podrá tener variedad y podrá incrementar las ventas. Su meta es superarse cada día más junto a su hijo.
texts.en:
Karen, 33, is a single mother who has one child.  She lives in the town of Las Vegas in the department of Santa Barbara, along with her parents and her son.

She has had her own business for 2 years, selling food products including: rice, beans, dairy products, meat, bread, churros, etc.  This business is her only source of income, and she has been able to keep the business stable through her good management and reinvestment of profits.  She is requesting a loan for 12,000 Honduran lempiras to buy products that she doesn't have that her customers are demanding.  This way, she will have a greater variety of goods and so will be able to increase her sales.  Her goal is to make progress each day along with her child.

loans.use: to stock up her business with a variety of food products

loans.name: Ana Sarai

texts.es:
Ana, solicita un nuevo préstamo para poder invertir en el cultivo de maíz , comprandose los materiales necesarios como el abono, herbicidas, otros fertilizantes que son necesarios y también pagando mano de obra para poder trabajar en la siembra, este préstamo le brindara los recursos necesarios para qué pueda continuar trabajando en la agricultura.
Con el préstamo anterior logró comprarse los materiales que le permitieron aumentar la productividad en sus tierras, permitiéndole  aumentar sus ingresos a través de las ventas, gracias a kiva ella desea seguir trabajando y seguirse superando junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana is seeking a new loan so that she can grow corn.  She will buy the required materials such as compost, herbicides and other fertilizers.  She will also use the funds to pay laborers to help with the planting.  This loan will allow her to have the resources necessary so that she continue farming.

With her previous loan she was able to buy materials that enabled her to increase the productivity of her crops.  This in turn helped her to increase her income.  Thanks to Kiva she wants to keep working and continuing to make progress along with her family.

loans.use: to buy compost, herbicides and other fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Frank S.

texts.en: This is 54-year-old Frank. He is married and has 5 children aged 33, 30, 27, 24, and 20. He has 3 additional dependents who live with him. They are staying with him for schooling. In 1985, Frank established his drug business for patients. He began his business to enable him to solve his domestic problems. He acquired his skills through apprenticeship. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, he earns about LE 650,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of LE 4,000,000. Frank requires a loan in order to buy paracetamol, chloroquine syrup, and penicillin syrup. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately LE 370,000. In the future, Frank plans to rent another shop in an ideal location and to educate his children. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy drugs for patients.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: This is 38-year-old Kadiatu.  She is married and has 1 child aged 10 who is in school. She has 1 additional dependent who lives with her for schooling.  In 2004, Kadiatu established her cosmetics business. She began her business because she wants to support her child's education. This business is her only source of income. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 580,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. Kadiatu requires a loan in order to buy cosmetics such as pure skin, doctor clear, citrine, and mekako spirit. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 260,000. In the future, Kadiatu plans to travel abroad, to build a house and to educate her son. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for her shop.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda works hard to support her family. Imelda is married and has an auto repair shop business in the Philippines.

Imelda requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy parts and other equipment for her business.

Imelda has been in this business for 21 years now.

In the future, Imelda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy parts and other equipment for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastic shoes.

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en:
Dalal is 26 years old and married with two children. Since last year she has owned a shop where she sells home products such as utensils and appliances.

Dalal is applying for a 2500 USD youth loan from Ryada in order to buy more stock for her shop and expand her shop’s space. She hopes that this will help her increase her income and develop her career.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her shop and expand her shop’s space.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es: Doña María de 58 años de edad,  soltera, tiene 6 hijos, vive en el municipio de Villanueva junto a su hijo menor y una hermana. Ella es muy trabajadora tiene un negocio de elaboración de tortillas de maíz desde hace 10 años en su casa, y vende todo el día. Tiene buena clientela  en la comunidad.  Para mantener activo su negocio solicita un préstamo por 3,700 lempiras  con el cual comprara los insumos como el maíz y leña para  la elaboración de tortillas. Su meta es que su hijo menor termine los estudios y que su negocio siempre se mantenga activo.
texts.en: Maria, 58, is single and has 6 children.  She lives in the town of Villanueva with her youngest son and a sister.  She is very hardworking; she has had a business making corn tortillas in her house for 10 years.  She sells all day long.  She has a good customer base in the community.  In order to keep her business running, she is requesting a loan of 3,700 Honduran lempiras, which she will use to buy supplies to make tortillas, such as corn and firewood.  Her goal is to keep her business running and have her youngest child finish his education.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make tortillas, including corn and firewood

loans.name: Maria Angela

texts.es:
María, solicita un nuevo préstamo para poder invertir en la compra de tres cerdos para el destazo, comprará también concentrado alimentarlos por un tiempo, este crédito le ayudará a mantener en su granja un número considerable de cerdos y así continuar trabajando en el destanzo y venta de carne.

El préstamo anterior logro también realizar una buena compra, de los cuáles obtuvo resultados positivos, ya que al comercializarlo le generó un margen de ganancia, con su familia ha logrado mejorar las condiciones del hogar, todo a través de los préstamos obtenidos con esta institución.
texts.en:
María is seeking a new loan so that she can buy three pigs for butchering.  She will also buy feed for the animals.  This loan will enable her to maintain a considerable number of pigs on her farm and thus be able to continue to work as a butcher and to sell meat.

With the previous loan she was also able to make a good purchase, which led to her making a profit.  With her family she has managed to improve their living conditions, all thanks to the loans she has received from this institution.

loans.use: to buy three pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy plastic slippers.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 34 years old and married with 2 children.

Maribel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell.

Maribel has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from direct sales of beauty products and ready-to-wear products.

Maribel aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita is forty years old, married and has four children. For the past eight years she has bought and sold fish to earn a living.

Sherlita became a member of HSPFI starting this year. She has requested a 4,000 PHP loan to buy a variety of fish such as milk fish, flying fish and sardines to sell. She hopes to grow her business so she can afford to continue sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 66 years old and married with one child. She runs a retail shop, a business she has done for the last twenty years. She earns a monthly income of KES 8,000.

She has applied for her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD. She plans to use the loan to purchase more stock of sugar, bread, flour, and rice. 

She will invest the anticipated profits back into her business. Her future dreams are to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of sugar, bread, flour, and rice.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 38 years old, married, and lives in the Philippines.

Juliet is selling longganisa (sausage) in their village. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy raw ingredients for making longganisa like fresh meat and spices.

Juliet has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making longganisa (sausage).

loans.name: Lorena Maria

texts.es: Lorena  de 26 años de edad  vive en un  municipio del departamento de Bolívar, donde atiende su pequeño negocio de vender  útiles escolares y artículos de papelería en general; actividad en la que tiene 8 años de experiencia, pues trabajó en una papelería  y hace  5 años tradujo su conocimiento del mercado,  a  su propia aventura emprendedora, la cual ubicó en su casa familiar. La modalidad de sus ventas es de estricto contado, pero algunas veces hace créditos y las realiza diariamente desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 8:30 de la noche de lunes a Domingo. Su esmerado esfuerzo se debe a que quiere alcanzar sus metas de capitalizar su microempresa  mediante el ahorro para poder prosperar cada día más. Lorena viaja a la ciudad de Barranquilla donde compra mercancías con las que surte su negocio e impacta  a sus clientes, que son principalmente jóvenes en las edades de 12 a 25 años, aunque también vende a madres de familia. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hará a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará artículos de fantasía, variedades, ropa para damas bolsos y perfumería, pues quiere agregar estos artículos a su oferta, teniendo en cuenta que son muchas las personas que por ellos preguntan y que a su vez  un potencial de clientes y un buen punto comercial donde ofrecerlos. Su meta mas adelante es agregar los servicios de tecnología de la comunicación, para que todos en el pueblo puedan acceder a las redes, estén actualizadas, hagan tareas etc. El éxito de su credikiva, es que su inversión está basada en la demanda del mercado y en la capacidad de compra que da el efectivo, el cual le permite acceder a las buenas ofertas de sus proveedores, que también necesitan vender de contado.
texts.en:
Lorena, age 26, lives in a municipality in the Bolívar department.  That is where she tends her small business selling school supplies and general stationery items.  She has eight years of experience in this business activity.  She worked in a stationery store, and five years ago she converted her knowledge of the market into her own entrepreneurial adventure.  It is located at her house.  Her sales are strictly for cash.  However, sometimes she takes credit.  She works from 6:00 a.m. until 8:30 p.m. on Monday through Sunday.

Her painstaking effort is due to wanting to reach her goal of capitalizing her small business through savings.  She wants to do this in order to be able to prosper more each day.  Lorena travels to the city of Barranquilla where she buys merchandise to stock her business.  She does this to impact her customers, who are primarily young people between the ages of 12 and 25.  She sometimes sells to mothers.

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan, which is her first loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She will use the loan to buy costume jewelry, variety items, women’s clothes, and perfume.  She wants to add these items to what she sells, keeping in mind that there are a lot of people who request these items.  In turn, they are potential customers, and she has a good commercial place for her sales.

Her goal for further on is to add communication technology services.  She wants to do this so that everyone in her town is able to access the networks, be up to date, and do their jobs, etc.

Her Kiva loan will be successful because her investment is based on the market demand and the purchasing capacity from purchasing in cash.  This will allow her access to good offers from her providers, who also need to sell for cash.

loans.use: to buy costume jewelry, variety items, women’s clothes, and perfume.

loans.name: Jose Adolfo

texts.es:
José, solicita un nuevo préstamo para realizar la compra de ganado de repasto, en esta ocasión comprara unos terneros que le permitirá a futuro realizar una ganancia, ya que están pequeños y los crecerá.
Su experiencia con el préstamo anterior fue positiva ya que le aumentó el hato ganadero, se ha mantenido comercializando con sus clientes y al mismo tiempo ha mejorado su situación en la familia proveyendo mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
José is seeking a new loan in order to buy livestock for his farm.  He will buy a number of calves which he will raise and then sell in the future, thus making a profit.

His experience with his previous loan was positive since he was able to increase his flock.  He has been able to continue to sell his livestock, and at the same time he has improved his family situation and provided increased income.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en: This is 48-year-old Ernest. He is married and has 3 children aged 3, 7, and 12. He has 1 additional dependent who lives with him to assist a younger brother with his education. In 2008, Ernest established business selling building materials and sportswear. The business was started to complement his job with district football and to increase his income. Working 6 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about SLL 2,874,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Ernest has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy more cement. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 689,760. In the future, Ernest plans to improve on the sale of imported cement. He thanks you for your support

loans.use: to pay for cement.

loans.name: Sento

texts.en: This is 40-year-old Sento. She is married and has 4 children aged 3, 7, 12 and 18. She has 1 additional dependent who lives with her to help with the house chores. In 2002, Sento established her business selling shoes, dresses, pants, sandals, earrings, and chains. She began her business to help her husband with the children's education. Working 12 days a week and 7 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,053,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. Sento requires a loan in order to improve on the sale of ladies' slippers. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 306,370. In the future, Sento plans to move from a stall to a shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for shoes, dresses, pants, earrings, and chains.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is 37 years old, single, and lives in the Philippines. Rowena has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She has had this business for 8 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Rowena has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Rowena hopes to improve her business for the education of her nephew.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 45 years old. He is married to Lucy and together they have seven children. He operates a mechanical and body repair shop besides being a farmer.

This is his first term loan with KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer. He will use the loan to purchase machines for his business.

He hopes to start a real estate business.

loans.use: to purchase machines for his business.

loans.name: Chann

texts.en:
Chann is a resident from Ek Phnom district of Battambang Province, Cambodia. She is aged 63 years old and a married mother of nine children. Some of the children are helping the family's business, while the remaining children are selling sweets in order to earn extra income for the family. 

To strive for a living, she has been growing corn, watermelon, and beans for 40 years; her husband also helps to generate more income via paddy rice growing. For her, the main challenge is the drought which made her cash-crops fruitless.  

This is the third cycle loan for Chann with VisionFund. The past two loans have sustained her business activity and improved her family's livelihood. From her past experience, Chann is confident in applying for a new loan in the amount of USD 1,000. 

In order to boost her crop productivity, $700 will be used for purchasing pipes for water pumping, fertilizer, and insecticides, while the remaining amount will be used to buy a sugarcane squeezing machine so she can earn additional income. 

She expects to receive more crop yields so that she can make more profit to support her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pipes for water pumping, insecticides, and a sugarcane squeezing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmestics, bags, and dresses.

loans.name: Mialyn

texts.en:
Mialyn is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 
Mialyn is selling fish in her community. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy variety of fish to re-sell like milk fish and sardines.
Mialyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Mialyn hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy variety of fish to re-sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 32 years old. He is a single businessman but he supports his parents. He has been running a food stall, a business he has had for the last six years, with a monthly income of KES 19,500. 

He is applying for his fourth loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loans successfully. James will use the loan to buy rice, sugar, and cooking oil for the business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will expand his business. His hopes and dreams are to open a restaurant and educate his siblings.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Batbileg

texts.en: Batbileg lives with her husband and her 3 children in a ger (a Mongolian yurt) in Bayanzurh district, Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. She moved to Ulaanbaatar city with her family from Sukhbaatar aimag in 2004. Her older two daughters are 17 and 13 years old and they go to secondary school. Her youngest  daughter is in kindergarden, and she is 3 years old. In 2012 she is planning to start her own grocery store business. Her husband will help her in business. She would like the start her business by purchasing a variety of goods to offer at her store. She needs 4,000,000 MNT to purchase goods to sell at her new grocery store.

loans.use: to purchase goods to sell at her new grocery store.

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 64 years, married, and blessed with five children whom she supports. She is a mixed-crop farmer. For the last 10 years, she has earned a monthly income of KES 2,000.
 
She has applied for her fourth loan of KES 40,000 with KADET LTD, which she plans to use to purchase farm inputs (e.g., fertilizers and pesticides) and pay for labor. 

She will invest the anticipated profits back into her business. Her future dream is to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs (e.g., fertilizers and pesticides) and pay for labor.

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widow with 6 children. 
Miguela makes and sells school and office uniforms. She has had this business for 8 years. She requested a loan for PHP 4,000 to buy textiles.
Miguela has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Miguela hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more textiles for making school and office uniforms.

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural area located in Moung Russey district of Battambang Province, Sokha is married and a 28-year-old mother of two dependent children still too young for school. Her major source of income is the rice she grows on a hectare of farmland. She also sells groceries and is a wedding facilitator, supplying makeup for the bride and decorations for the ceremony. She has been earning money through these businesses for five years and earns about 40,000 KHR a month.

Sokha has taken out loans through VisionFund three times and completely repaid them. Profits that resulted from the past loans have resulted in a better life for her family. Now she has formed a two-women group seeking a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR. Of that, she will take 1,400,000 KHR while the other member will take 600,000 KHR.

Sokha plans to use her loan portion to buy additional grocery items such as instant noodles, canned food, shampoo, etc. to sell. She will also use part of it to buy decoration materials for her wedding facilitator business. She hopes to increase her income so she can set aside money for future needs.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery items and wedding decoration materials.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has nine children. 

Caridad is selling snacks in their local community like banana cake and hotcake. She has had this business for six years. She requested a loan for PHP 3,000 to buy raw ingredients like flour, sugar, and cheese for making snacks.

Caridad has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients like sugar, flour, and cheese for making snacks.

loans.name: Blanca Cecilia

texts.es:
Blanca, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo pues considera estar mejorando su condición en el negocio a través de las inversiones que ha realizado, se comprará plátanos, yuca, repollo, tomates, aceite y leña, este material se utiliza a diario para la elaboración de las meriendas.
El préstamo anterior le dio un efecto positivo,  ya que ha mantenido y ha continuado realizando sus ventas a los clientes, en su familia su condición está estable, sus ingresos se ha mantenido y su deseo de superación continua a través del apoyo que recibe de los préstamos.
texts.en:
Blanca has decided on a loan because she believes that she’s improving her business situation by means of the investments she’s made.  She will buy bananas, manioc, cabbage, tomatoes, oil and firewood.  These materials are used daily to prepare the meals.

The previous loan had a positive effect because she’s been able to remain in operation and has continued selling to customers.  Her family situation is stable and her income has remained steady.  Her drive to improve continues through the support she gets from the loans.

loans.use: to buy fruit, vegetables, oil and firewood.

loans.name: Saran

texts.en: Saran is a 40-year-old woman who lives with her husband and two children in Sukhbaatar province of Mongolia. Her husband helps with her business. Her older daughter goes to the high school and her son goes to the middle school. Today, she is well-experienced in vegetable-growing and the local residents appreciate her as a hardworking person. She started her own vegetable-growing business in 2010. Currently, Saran grows vegetables in a .5 hectare yard. She is planning to build a greenhouse and expand her business. She says "I wish that everybody eats healthy food to stay healthy." She is requesting a 5,000,000 MNT loan to buy and build a greenhouse.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse and expand her business.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 50 years old and married with six children. He has operated a retail business for the last ten years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000. He has applied for his second loan of KES 50,000 from KADET LTD which he plans to use to purchase more stock of foodstuffs such as wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice demanded by his clients.

He will invest the anticipated profits back into his business. His future dream is to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of foodstuffs such as wheat flour and maize flour, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Lilibeth

texts.en:
Lilibeth is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Lilibeth has a tailoring shop that makes and sells curtains and sports attire. She has had this business for 7 years. She requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy more textiles.
Lilibeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Lilibeth hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy textiles for making curtains and sports attire.

loans.name: Nurbaity

texts.en:
Nurbaity, 36, is married to Iguan, 39. They are blessed with 3 children: Rafli, 13 years old; Andika, 10 years old; and Irene, 8 years old. All of the children are attending school. 

Nurbaity lives with her 3 children as her husband is working on a ship and returns home once a year. Even so, Iguan always sends his monthly income to Nurbaity. Being aware of the children's needs, household expenses, and other possible emergency needs, Nurbaity decided to run a kiosk business in front of her house in 2008. 

Nurbaity would like to improve her monthly income so she can fully cover her children's educational expenses. Therefore, she applied for a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 3,000,000 to buy more stock for her kiosk, e.g., coffee, tea, instant noodles, instant spices, soap, detergent, oil, kerosene, etc. In addition she would also like to purchase cake ingredients, as she wants to sell several cakes at her kiosk. She hopes that the loan will help her improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her kiosk, e.g., coffee, tea, instant noodles, instant spices, soap, detergent, oil, kerosene, and also to purchase cake ingredients .

loans.name: Richard Coca

texts.en:
Richard Coca is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 2 children. 
Richard Coca is providing "habal-habal" or motorcycle services. He has had this business for 5 years. He requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the services.
Richard Coca has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Richard Coca hopes to improve his services for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Luis Alonso

texts.es:
Luis, solicita un préstamo para comprarse los materiales porque va a realizar la siembra, también pagara mano de obra para que puedan los mozos preparar el terreno donde realizara el cultivo, su compra sera el abono y los insecticidas, que son utilizados para proteger la siembra de la maleza y de las plagas, este préstamo le ayudara para que Luis puede realizar su trabajo en el campo de una manera ordenada y con los recursos necesarios.

El efecto que tuvo con el préstamo anterior fue una buena inversión en la siembra de maíz y el proceso de caña de azúcar, esto le ha generado a él, trabajo para todo este período manteniendo sus ventas, está muy agradecido con los préstamos que se le han brindado pues se ha generado mejores ganancias y mejor condición de vida junto con su familia todo a través de los préstamos con kiva.
texts.en:
Luis is requesting a loan to buy supplies, because he is going to plant some crops.  He will pay for some labor, so that he can have some young men prepare the land where he will plant his crops, and he will also buy manure and insecticides that he will use to protect the crops from weeds and pests.  This loan will help Luis carry out his work in the fields in an orderly manner, with the resources that he needs.

With his prior loan, he made a good investment in the cultivation of corn and processing of sugar cane.  This has generated work for him over all of this time, so that he could maintain his sales.  He is very grateful for the loans that have been provided to him. Through the loans funded by Kiva, he has been able to increase his earnings and have a better quality of life with his family.

loans.use: to buy manure and insecticides

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es: Aurora, de 47 años de edad , madre soltera , tiene dos hijos se dedica a la venta de  comida , desde hace 6 años , es originaria de Leon. Su negocio lo empezó con la venta de refrescos y gaseosas, peo con el tiempo fue agregando la venta de comida, obteniendo buenos resultados , pero noto que la hacía surtir mas su negocio , ya que su propósito es expandirse , tener puesto venta de leche agria, refrescos , comidas ya que este tipo de alimentos es muy buscado por sus clientes que vienen de todas partes pues León es una ciudad muy turística. Ella está solicitando el crédito para comprar frutas, gaseosas, verduras, arroz, frijoles, carne. Ya que son ingredientes que utiliza para preparar para su comida. Además quiere vender más snacks en su pequeño puesto, donde también la visitan los estudiantes.
texts.en: Aurora, 47, is a single mother of two.  She has had a business selling food for 6 years. She is a native of the city of Leon.  She started her business selling soft drinks and other beverages, but over time she added the sale of food.  She was getting good results, but she noticed that she needed to stock up her business, since her goal was to expand it. She has a stall where she sells fermented milk, beverages and the types of food products that are sought after by her customers, who come from all over since Leon is a city with a lot of tourism.  She is requesting a loan to buy fruit, soft drinks, vegetables, rice, beans and meat, because these are ingredients that she uses to prepare her food.  In addition, she wants to sell more snacks from her small stall, where she is also visited by students.

loans.use: to buy fruit, soft drinks, vegetables, rice, beans and meat

loans.name: Melkianus

texts.en: Melkianus is a 38-year-man. He has a son, Kristian, 3 years old. Melkianus generates income by being a fishmonger. He usually sells fish at the daily market from 5 a.m. to 9 a.m. If the fish are not sold out at the market, he sells them around his village in the afternoon. Besides selling fish, Melkianus also sells daily basic needs e.g., instant noodles, instant spices, snacks, coffee, and tea at his house. He displays these things in an old cupboard. Melkianus really wants to improve his business but unfortunately he doesn’t have enough capital to do so. He requested a loan of IDR 4,500,000 from TLM to be spent on various kiosk products as well as more fish to sell. Melkianus hopes that his business will improve after he gets the loan assistance.

loans.use: to buy more stock for his kiosk e.g., snacks, coffee, tea, etc., and also to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en: Rosita is 54 years old, married, and lives in the Philippines. Rosita has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products, and beverages. She had this business for 8 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Rosita has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Rosita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

loans.name: Bebilinda

texts.en:
Bebilinda is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Bebilinda is buying and selling RTW's or ready-to-wears like blouses, t-shirts, pants, and footwear. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more RTW's to re-sell.
Bebilinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Bebilinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy RTW's (ready-to-wears) to re-sell.

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is fort- six years old. She has been running a cereals business for the last ten years, earning a monthly income of KES 28,000.

She has applied for her second loan of KES 60,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to purchase more stock of maize, beans, and peas for sale. 

She will invest the anticipated profits back into her business. Her future dream is to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of maize, beans, and peas.

loans.name: Dewi

texts.en:
Dewi is a 33-year-old lady and is married to Rifai, a 38 year old man. They have three children, namely Shifa, 9 years old, who is in the 4th grade; Hasnah, 7 years old, who is in the 2nd grade; and Kana, 2 years old. 

Dewi is a pharmacist who generates income by supplying medicine to the villagers in the area where she resides. In addition to her drugstore business, Dewi would like to initiate a new business selling meatballs. To implement her plan, Dewi requested a loan amounting to IDR 12,500,000 from TLM to purchase meat, a refrigerator, and cooking ingredients, and to provide building materials to build the stall, e.g., sand, brick, cement, etc.

loans.use: to purchase meat, a refrigerator, and cooking ingredients, and to provide building materials to build the stall, e.g., sand, brick, cement, etc.

loans.name: Jenifer

texts.en:
Jenifer is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
Jenifer has a shop that sells purified drinking water and DVD's. She has had this business for 7 years. She requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy more stocks of purified drinking water and DVD's to re-sell.
Jenifer has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Jenifer hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of purified drinking water and DVD's to re-sell

loans.name: Ann

texts.en:
Ann is thirty-four years old, married with two children. She has been earning a living from her salon business for the last six years with monthly income of KES 5,600.

She has applied her second loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to purchase more stock of braids, hair chemicals and shampoo. 

The anticipated profits will be invested back into her business. Her future dream is to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of braids, hair chemicals and shampoo.

loans.name: Ratha's Group

texts.en:
Ratha, aged 43, is a married woman with one daughter. Her daughter is staying with her and helping with the family's business, sweets and mixed fruit juice selling. Ratha has been running this business for 10 years while her husband earns extra income as a construction worker. Ratha received her first loan with VisionFund one cycle ago. The past first loan, which she has completely paid back, has enabled her business to move forward and build a proper house.

 Her group consists of two female members--the other member is also a second loan cycle client. With a good business, she is applying for a new loan of 1,200,000 KHR. As the leader, Ratha will use her loan portion to buy more ingredients for making sweets including sugar, chicken's eggs, fruit, etc. She hopes that she can earn more income from the current business so as to expand her business bigger than before.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for making sweets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more kiosk products, i.e., cigarettes, daily basic needs, beverages and also mobile phone recharges.

loans.name: Dolphine

texts.en:
Dolphine is thirty-four years old and married with two children. She runs a clothing business, earning a monthly income of KES 9,300 for the last two years.


She has applied for her first loan of KES 20,000 from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to purchase more stock of sweaters, skirts and blouses for sale. 

She will invest the anticipated profits back into her business. Her future dreams are to have a happy family and open a boutique.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of sweaters, skirts and blouses.

loans.name: Mercedes Concepcion

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes de 58 años se dedica a la fabricacion de ropa de cama (fundas, hedredones, juego de baños)desde hace 17 sños, ella inicia su actividad a las 7 de la mañana y termina a las 10 de la noche. Nos cuenta que una vez que inicia su trabajo no se despega de la maquina de coser hasta que termina. labora de lunes a sabado y a veces los domingos con el objetivo de avanzar en el trabajo. lo hace tambien por la cantidad de pedidos que tenga. su elaboracion de un hedredon lo realiza en el lapso de 3 dias cortando, pegando y haciendo plisados. inicio con una hermana aprendiendo a cocer y poco tiempo despues su hermana le regalo una maquina de coser y tambien le ayudo a pagar el curso de costura y es en ese momento se independiza. Hoy en dia cuenta con 4 maquinas de coser. Entre otros productos ella confecciona cojines en forma de corazones y esto lo hace principalmente para el dia de las madres y de los maestros. Antes de iniciar este negocio ella le trabajaba a una señora en venta de ropa americana. 
El credito anterior le ha sido de gran ayuda porque le ha permitido comprar sus maquinas y a la vez le permite mantener en existencia materia prima. ademas con sus ganancias ha podido hacerle mejoras a su vivienda, compra de electrodomestico, ropas y zapatos para ella y su esposo. Tiene 3 hijos los cuales son independientes. vive unicamente con su esposo el cual esta jubilado. Nos comento que con este credito le permitira comprar materia prima (variedad de colores y estilos de telas)para satisfacer los gustos y preferencias de sus clientes.Este credito le ayudara a cumplir su sueño de continuar confeccionando, ya que esto es lo que mas le gusta
texts.en:
Mercedes, 58, has been manufacturing bed linens (pillow cases, comforters and bath sets) for the last 17 years.  She starts work at 7am and finishes at 10pm.  She relates that once she starts work she does not leave her sewing machine until she completes it.  She works Monday through Saturday and sometimes on Sundays too in order to advance.  She also works according to the number of orders she has pending.  It takes her three days to make a comforter cutting, sewing and pleating.  

She started out with one of her sisters learning to sew little by little and shortly thereafter her sister gave her a sewing machine and also helped her pay for a sewing course and that was when she was able to become independent.  Today, she owns four sewing machines.  Among other products, she makes heart-shaped cushions especially for Mother’s Day and for Teacher’s Day.  Prior to starting this business she worked for a lady selling American clothes.

The previous loan was of great help to her because she was able to buy her sewing machines as well as to have raw materials on hand.  Also, with her profits she’s been able to do some home improvements buying home appliances, clothes and shoes for her and her husband.  She has three children who are independent now; she lives only with her husband who is now retired.  

She relates that with this loan she’ll be able to buy raw materials (assorted colors and styles of fabric) to satisfy the taste and preferences of her customers.  This loan will help her make her dream of continuing to sew a reality since this is what she likes best.

loans.use: to buy sewing supplies.

loans.name: Luis Miguel

texts.es:
Luis es un Joven de 20 años que vive en la comuna de Congoma en la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsachillas. Santo Domingo es la tercera ciudad más grande de Ecuador en cuanto a población, y se encuentra ubicado en un punto estratégico para el comercio ecuatoriano ya que se ubica en el centro, actuando como unión entre la costa y la sierra. Por esta razón, Santo Domingo también es un centro multicultural donde se encuentran y fusionan varias culturas provenientes de ecuador e inclusive de afuera del país. Además de nutrirse del comercio, la provincia también cuenta con fuertes ingresos de la ganadería y la agricultura de los diferentes cultivos que se dan allí.
De esta ciudad en desarrollo sale Luis. El tan solo alcanzo a completar la escuela primaria ya que desde chiquito ayudaba mucho a sus padres en su negocio. Ahora ya cuenta con negocio propio al que le invierte en promedio 10 horas diarias de trabajo, no obstante es de suma importancia para Luis poder adquirir el préstamo que está buscando. Lo necesita para comprar abono para tratar la tierra donde crece sus cultivos y así mejorar su producción para poder aumentar sus ingresos económicos que al momento no le alcanzan para vivir como él quisiera.
texts.en:
Luis, 20, is a young man living in the Congoma commune in Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas Province.  Santo Domingo is Ecuador’s third largest city in population and it’s located in a strategic spot for Ecuadorean commerce because it’s in the center acting as a meeting point between the coast and the mountains.  Because of this, Santo Domingo is also a multicultural center where many cultures from both Ecuador and from outside the country meet and fuse.  In addition to commerce, animal husbandry and farming the various crops that grow there are strong sources of income.

Luis is from this developing city.  He was only able to complete elementary school because he’s been helping his parents with their business since he was a little boy.  Now he has a business of his own in which he spends ten hours daily.  Nonetheless, it’s of utmost importance for Luis to be able to acquire the loan he’s seeking.  He needs it to buy manure to treat the soil where his crops grow to improve production and increase income which currently is insufficient for him to live like he’d like to.

loans.use: to buy manure.

loans.name: Chariya's Group

texts.en: Chariya is a young 28-year-old mother living in a rural area located in the Ek Phnom District of Battambang Province. She has only one son, and he is still in school. To support her household, she runs a small tailoring shop from home. Chariya also owns a speaker and a rice threshing machine for rent. For the 15 years that she has been involved in this business, she has been able to earn approximately 67,000 KHR. After all expenses are accounted, she can save about 14,000 KHR per day. Chariya's group consists of three female members and she is the group leader. She is a 7th loan cycle client, the second group member is an 11th loan cycle client, and the remaining group member is a 4th loan cycle client. Chariya has completely repaid her past 6 loans, and they have uplifted her family's living conditions gradually. She, as the group leader, is applying for a new loan in the amount of 1,400,000 KHR to buy additional electronic accessories to support her loudspeaker-renting business. Moreover, some portion of it will be used to fix the threshing machine. She hopes to increase her household’s income and earn a good living in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional electronic accessories to support her loudspeaker business and to fix her rice threshing machine.

loans.name: Marianus

texts.en:
Marianus is a 35-year-old man and is married to Yacomina, a 32-year -old lady. They have been blessed with three children: Putri, 8, attending 3rd grade; Julien, 5; and Juvito, 3. 

Marianus has been running a minivan business for 10 months. Prior to running this business, Marianus used to work as a minivan driver for years. Marianus spent his savings to purchase a minivan as he wants to run his own business. He drives the minivan from his village to transport the passengers from downtown and otherwise. The income from the business is not always stable. This has become the reason why Marianus dreams of improving his business by selling coconuts and pigs downtown. To do so, he is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 10,000,000.

loans.use: to purchase and re-sell coconuts and pigs.

loans.name: Dixie Love

texts.en:
Dixie Love is 21 years old, single and lives in the Philippines. 

Dixie Love has a small store that sells snacks like biscuits and chocolates. She has had this business for  3 years.She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy more snacks to re-sell.

Dixie Love has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Dixie Love hopes to improve her business so she can continue her studies.

loans.use: to buy stocks of snacks to re-sell

loans.name: Lawrence

texts.en:
Lawrence is 31 years old and a business man. He is married to Veronica who is a business lady. They are blessed with two children aged four years old and four months old. He has been running a retail shop for the past seven years with the monthly income of KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Lawrence will use the loan to purchase more stock of sugar, rice and cooking oil for sale. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a supermarket and improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of sugar, rice and cooking oil.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 34 years old, married, and lives in the Philippines.

Edna is selling dried fish in their local market. She has had this business for 9 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of dried fish to re-sell.

Edna has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Edna hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of dried fish to re-sell

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is  36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Victoria  has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store that buys & sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products & beverages. She had this business for 7  years.

 She requested a loan for  3,000 PHP  to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages. Victoria  has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Victoria hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is thirty-four years old and married with two children. He has been running a butcher's shop for the last 14 years, earning a monthly income of KES 9,500.

He has applied for his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD, which he plans to use to purchase more stock of meat for sale.


With the anticipated profits, he will invest back into his business. His future dream is to have a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of meat for sale

loans.name: Kimthan's Group

texts.en:
Kimthan is 42 years old. She is married and has two sons who are still dependent on her as they are in school. To tackle the family's hardships, she has been selling clothes at the traditional market in the community for 18 years and her husband raises fish for sale. Due to shortage of capital, Kimthan has formed a group of two to seek a new loan. 

This is the fifth loan cycle for Kimthan as well as for her group member. She has repaid the past four loans with success; now she feels confident that she can well-manage her household as well as her business. Her requested amount for this cycle is 1,400,000 KHR, the same amount as her group member. As the group leader, she is going to use her loan portion to buy more fingerlings to raise and fish feed. Besides that, a portion of her loan will be used to buy more clothes to resell. She expects to earn more income from her current business so as to keep her children in school until tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy more fingerlings, fish feed, and clothes for resale

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 22 years old. He is married to Mary who is a farmer.They do not have any children. He works in a quarry and has been in the business for the past four years.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced by a field officer. He will use the loan amount to purchase another quarry site.

He hopes to purchase a truck to aid him in transportation of stones to construction sites.

loans.use: to purchase another quarry site

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay off a debt.

loans.name: Julio Rodolfo

texts.es: El joven Julio , de 24 años de edad , de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de ropa usada. Primero comenzó vendiendo ropa usada en su casa. Después poco a poco fue buscando un local más céntrico donde poner su negocio, le ha ido muy bien, lleva dos años con este negocio , con el cual mantiene a su familia y paga sus estudios en la universidad . El se considera un hombre progresista con deseos de superarse y darle lo mejor a su familia. Además de vender ropa también quiere vender zapatos y convertirse en un comerciante muy conocido y que su mercadería sea bastante accesible para su clientela el está requiriendo el préstamo para comprar ropa usada.
texts.en:
Julio is a young 24 year old man who is a merchant. He makes a living selling used clothing. He first began selling used clothing in his hour. After, little by little he went in search for a more central locale where he could set up his business. It has gone very well for him, he has been in this business for two years.  With the business he supports his family and pays his university costs. 

He considers himself to be a progressive man with hopes to move himself up and give his family the best. In addition to selling clothing he also wants to sell shoes. He wants to become a very well known seller and make his goods affordable enough for his customers. He needs this loan to buy used clothing.

loans.use: to buy used clothing.

loans.name: Ana Francisca

texts.es: Ana, se dedica a atender una pequeña pulpería la cual tiene en su casa de habitación su pareja es albañil , mientras el sale hacer su trabajo en la construcción , ella trabaja en la pulpería donde atiende  su hogar, sus hijos , hace el inventario de los productos que se están acabando, los mas solicitados por sus clientela que a diario la visita. Antes ella solo vendia frijoles cosidos tortilla pero con paso del tiempo fue agregando mas productos para vender. Lleva 1 año con este negocio de pulpería el cual le permite generar ingresos por cuenta propia. Esta solicitando el crédito para comprar granos básicos, pan, huevo, productos enlatados, snacks, gaseosas, jugos. Pues son los productos que mas demandan sus clientes. Su proyecto es hacer crecer su negocio , surtirlo de mercadería nueva y variada darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Ana earns her living from a her small general store which is located in her house. Her husband is a bricklayer. While he is out doing construction work she works in the grocery store where she can look after the house, the children and does the inventory of products which are finishing and  those most in demand by her customers who visit her on a daily basis. Previously she used to only sell cooked beans and tortillas but with time she has added more products for sale. She has had this grocery shop business for one  year now and it has allowed her to generate her own income. 

She is asking for a loan to buy basic grains, bread, eggs, tinned products, snacks, soft drinks and juices as these are the products most in demand by her customers. Her project is to expand her business, supply it with new and varied merchandise and to provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, bread, eggs, tinned products, snacks, soft drinks and juices.

loans.name: Altantsetseg

texts.en:
Altantsetseg is 61 years old. She lives in a ger (traditional felt housing) with her husband, who is retired.  With her integrity and hardworking attitude, she started a dairy production business in 2000 with her husband and they have been still selling the milk to local residents. It is a family business. 

Altantsetseg used to work as a secretary, so she is very well skilled in organizing. Her business seems to be sustainable because she has already gained a number of regular customers from the local market. 

She needs 5,000,000 MNT to purchase some padding for the house and to build a new cow shelter, which will keep them warmer in the winter. Now she pays more for firewood and coal to heat the house and the cows stay outside in the cold weather. 

She said that the benefits of livestock are countless. For example, feeding children with milk is healthy, and that is why she loves her job.

loans.use: to purchase some padding for the house and build a new cow shelter.

loans.name: Chepita De Los Angeles

texts.es: La señora Chepita , de 38 años de edad, es dueña de una pulpería  y venta de leche agria , tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad. Su negocio lo empezó hace 5 años. También hace comida solo por encargo, vende frijoles cosidos. Todas estas actividades las realiza ella misma. Le gustaría expandirse, vender comida en Chinandega tener una pulpería, puesto de comida y ventas de leche agria en esa ciudad. Ella está solicitando el crédito para comprar arroz, frijoles, leche, pan, huevo, avenas, pasta de dientes, productos enlatados, frutas, vegetales, jugos. Ya que son productos de mucha necesidad en su comunidad.
texts.en: Chepita is 38 years old and has a three year old son.  She owns a general store and began her business five years ago. She sells “leche agria” (a fermented milk product), and also prepares made-to-order meals such as baked beans.  She does all of the work herself.  She would like to expand her business and sell meals in Chinandega.  She would like to have a general store, and a food stall and sell “leche agria” in that city.  She is requesting the loan to purchase rice, beans, milk, bread, eggs, oats, toothpaste, canned goods, fruit, vegetables, and juice because these products are much needed in the community.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, milk, bread, eggs, oats, toothpaste, canned goods, fruit, vegetables, and juice

loans.name: Estrella Brillante  2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Milagros is part of the group named Estrellas Brillante (Brilliant Stars) 2 & 3. She is the representative of this group and has proven to be a very hard-working woman. This group consists of 10 micro-entrepreneur people doing business in their rural community outside of El Seybo. She is the mother of four children, and she is working to help her long term partner to bring extra income and provide changes for her family.

Her business is pig sales. She raises them to be sold after 3-5 months. Also she sells pig meat to the neighbors (especially salty and seasoned pork).  After she had run her small business and invested in it for over seven years, she decided to start selling pigs, so this loan will be used to buy pigs. She is running her 13th loan with us.

Milagros and her group thank you all for your support!!!

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Sharavdochin

texts.en:
Sharavdochin, age 42, runs a public transportation business in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. After working for a public transportation company for twenty years, he decided to start a business by himself, using his own minivan. He has permission to carry passengers on one of the city’s remote bus lanes, which lacks bus services. 

Sharavdochin is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT (Mongolian Tugriks) loan to purchase cattle and to sell meat. Each Mongolian family uses cattle meat daily, so he wishes that his business will be very efficient and he will make an easier way to buy meat for the family that has lower income.  

His children – aged 8, 15, and 17 – attend public school, while his wife works in the book section of a department store. He aims to increase his family income by expanding his business in the future.

loans.use: to buy cattle and to sell meat for lower income people.

loans.name: Ronelyn

texts.en:
Ronelyn is 29 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Ronelyn is offering manicure and pedicure. She has had this business for 9 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy materials needed in manicure and pedicure like nail polish, acetone and nail cutters.

Ronelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Ronelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed in manicure and pedicure

loans.name: Macrine

texts.en:
Macrine is 50 years old, a widow blessed with four children who are over 18 years old. She is a poultry farmer, a practice she started two years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 30,000. 

She has requested a second loan of KES 40,000 to pay school fees for her college-going son. She hopes to have a stable business.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her son

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with 3 children. 

Samuel is buying and selling dried fish in their local community. He has had this business for 7 years. He requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy more dried fish.

Samuel has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Samuel hopes to improve his business for the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of dried fish to re-sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 32 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Jocelyn is selling snacks such as fruit and hot cakes. She has had this business for seven years. She requested a loan for 5,000 in order to buy raw ingredients, such as sugar, flour and cheese, for making snacks.

Jocelyn has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.

loans.name: Hosea

texts.en:
Hosea is 25 years old, single and with no dependents. He owns a cosmetics and beauty salon and barber shop,  businesses he started two years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 6,000.

He has requested his first loan of KES 20,000 to purchase more assorted cosmetics items for sale. The profit he makes from his businesses would help him expand his business by adding more stock. His dream is to own a business empire.

loans.use: To purchase more cosmetics for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 59 years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with 14 children. 

Virginia has a store that sells fruits such as bananas, melons and avocadoes. She has had this business for 12 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 in order to buy more fruit to resell.

Virginia has been a member of Kiva partner HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Virginia hopes to improve her business for the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to resell.

loans.name: Tita

texts.en:
Tita is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated and has five children. 

Tita has a store which sells viand, or foods like adobo, kare-kare and fried chicken. She has had this business for 10 years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making viand like fresh meat, vegetables and spices.

Tita has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for viand (food provisions) for her store.

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara cooks kenkey to sell in Abura. She is divorced and has five children. Hajara has been selling kenkey for 15 years now.  She uses her income to pay her utility and accommodation bills and to pay her children's school fees.

Hajara will use her loan to purchase bags of maize for the preparation of kenkey. She hopes to use the profits to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of maize for the preparation of kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama is a petty trader.   She  operates a grocery shop. The items in her grocery shop are milk, Milo (drink powder), sugar, soups, different kinds of soft  drinks, tinned tomatoes, tinned fish,  biscuits, toffees, powdered milk,  etc. Her store is in Nyame Bekyere near Abura.  She has been doing  this for 2 years now. 

Mariama  is single and has no children. She uses her income to pay her accommodation and utility bills.  Mariama  needs this loan to purchase a variety of groceries to satisfy her customers. With the new profit, Mariama wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of groceries to satisfy her customers

loans.name: Ghazwan

texts.en:
Ghazwan is a 54-year-old married man, father of four children. He has been working in the Internet business and in power supply for 21 years. In  2002 he started his own business and worked hard on improving it. 

Ghazwan is a hard worker who seeks perfection in his business. He provides internet services to most of his area's citizens since they aren't provided by the government and not all of the people have land line phones, so his business was and still is highly requested in his area. It is the same with the power supply he provides, since electricity is a major problem in the area; this kind of service no one can refuse.

He also provides cable television channels with affordable monthly fees, which is a service without which you can't find any house in Lebanon. That's why he has to update all of his electronic spare parts and hardware to make sure that his services are highly appreciated, and this is done through an applied-for loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua.

Ghazwan hopes to keep on expanding and improving his business as much as he can, and to adapt with any new released services.

loans.use: to support his business with new electronic spare parts

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Jocelyn has a video-k machine that has different kinds of songs. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy tools for the maintenance of the video-k machine.

Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools for the maintenance of her video-k machine

loans.name: Norm's Group

texts.en:
Norm,married, is a 46 year-old mother of six children living in the Moung Russsey district of Battambang Province, Cambodia. Currently, she is living with five children only, two of whom are still in school and the remaining three children are working for others for a fee. For her entire household, she struggles growing paddy rice on one hectare of farmland. To supplement the income, her husband also runs a small thatched place for fixing motorbikes and sometime he also works for others for pay too. Having been with these businesses for five years, they can earn about 18,000 KHR per day. 

Norm has been with Kiva partner VisionFund four loan cycle ago. She has used her loan effectively to grow her paddy rice in a timely way and to upgrade her lifestyle. Now, she leads a group of two females applying for a new loan:  both are requesting for the same amount, 1,400,000 KHR each. She will use her loan portion to buy fertilizer, insecticides, and to pay for ploughing fees. She expects to receive more crop yield in order to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticide, and to pay for ploughing fees.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 42 years-old.  He is married to Jane, a farmer, and together they have six children.  He operates a motorcycle and has been in the business for the past two years.

This will be his first loan from Kiva partner KADET LTD.  He will use the loan amount to add onto his savings and purchase a new motorcycle.  He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

In the future,  he will buy a taxi vehicle so as he can expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama  produces  'fanti kenkey' (fermented maize dough balls) for sale at Nyame Bekyere near Abura. She is a single parent and has 8 children.  Ama has been selling  'fanti kenkey'  for 15 years now. She uses her income to pay her children's school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize for the production of her 'kenkey' for sale. She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize for the production of her 'kenkey' for sale

loans.name: Rachel

texts.en:
Rachel has been doing farming in Olkalau town and it has been profitable, thereby enabling her to provide for her family's needs. She is 52 years old and married with five children.

This will be her third loan and she plans to buy fertilizer for use in her farm. Being a rainy season, she anticipates to make more profits with which she plans to pay school fees for her children.

In the future, Rachel hopes to increase her farming land and start zero grazing.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Jenny Maria

texts.es:
