Jenny es una mujer de 29 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca, se encuentra felizmente casada, tiene 2 pequeños hijos quienes son su mayor motivación para salir adelante; ella es una persona muy trabajadora, entusiasta y amable; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos no pudo terminar sus estudios secundarios, pero sueña con poder hacerlo muy pronto, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar con sus pequeños y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Pallares con Carne para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y entusiasmo Jenny puso en marcha su pequeño negocio de venta de abarrotes, día a día desde tempranas horas de la mañana Jenny inicia sus labores, ella dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 10 horas diarias y se siente a gusto realizando su labor y ella cree que le va bien ya que sus clientes la recomiendan por su buenos precios y por su trato amable.
Jenny se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el cercado de su vivienda con materiales adecuados, como es el ladrillo y concreto, asimismo podrá realizar un pequeño techado con calaminas; de esta manera Jenny podrá contar con una vivienda más adecuada y segura, la cual brinde las condiciones necesarias para asegurar el bienestar y mejor desarrollo de sus pequeños hijos, con ello en un futuro no muy lejano Jenny espera poder terminar la construcción total de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Jenny, 29, lives in Nazca. She is happily married and has two kids that are her greatest motivation to move forward in life. She is a hard-working, enthusiastic and kind person. Unfortunately, and due to the need to work and pay for her expenses, she was not able to graduate from high school but her dream is to do that soon. Jenny dedicates her free time to play with her kids and at times she makes some delicious pallares con carne to share with her family.
On her own initiative, with a lot of effort and enthusiasm, Jenny started her own business, a grocery shop. Day in and day out, Jenny starts to work very early in the morning. She spends approximately 10 hours a day at her business. She is comfortable doing her job and thinks she does okay since her customers recommend her because of her good prices and kindness.
Jenny is very grateful to Kiva loaners because thanks to their help she will be able to build a fence around her house with appropriate materials such as brick and concrete. She will also be able to put on a corrugated roof. Thus, Jenny will be able to have a more appropriate and safe house, providing the necessary conditions for the welfare and better development of her children. With this, Jenny aspires to completely finish the construction of her house in a not very distant future.

loans.use: To build a fence and a roof for her house

loans.name: Thais

texts.es: Thais, tiene la edad 21 de  años, está soltera y vive con su hijo y la madre  actualmente. Ella  pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de concentrado y algunas medicinas para los mismos. Ella cuenta con varios cerdos a su poder y lo que pretende es comprar concentrado para poder engordarlos en menor tiempo. Ella  quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. Ella quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y de la familia  y crecer con el proyecto de cerdos de engorde. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en: Thais is 21 years old, unmarried, and currently lives with her son and her mother.  With the loan, she intends to purchase concentrated feed and some medicines.  She has several pigs under her care and plans to purchase concentrated feed to fatten them in less time.  She wants her pigs to gain the ideal weight in order to sell them later at the local market and surrounding areas.  She wants to generate the greatest profits for her well-being and that of her family and grow her pig-fattening business. This is the first loan she is receiving from FUDECOSUR.  She has not had other loans with state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered the loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase concentrated pig feed.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Noemí, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se sigue dedicando al comercio de verduras, las cuales compra y las vende en los mercados principalmente de puerto Maldonado. Noemí es madre de dos niños, y por ellos se sacrifica todos los días con su actividad, para poder proporcionarles una mejor calidad de vida. La socia espera que en algún momento pueda llegar a ahorrar lo suficiente para poder construir su propia casa y brindarles mejor comodidad a sus hijos.
Noemí quiere en esta oportunidad invertirá su préstamo para comprar mercadería como lechugas, habas, arvejas, zanahorias, cebollas etc. para cubrir su demanda.
Noemí está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y poder darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
This member is Sra. Noemi, who belongs to the “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” Communal Bank in the city of Cusco, Perú. She continues selling vegetables, which she buys and sells principally in the markets of Puerto Maldonado. 

Noemi is the mother of two children and she sacrifices every day as she works to give them a better quality of life. She hopes at some point to be able to save enough money to be able to build her own house and provide more comfort to her children.

At this time, Noemi will invest her loan in the purchase of merchandise, such as lettuce, beans, peas, carrots, onions, etc, to cover her customers' demands. She is very grateful to KIVA for enabling her to give her family a better quality of life and her children a better education.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as lettuce, beans, peas, carrots, onions, etc.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 20 years-old.  She is a single mother of three children.  She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past six years.

This is her first term loan from Kiva partner KADET LTD.  She was introduced to them by one of their field officers.  She will use the loan amount to purchase seedlings and fertilizer to use on her farm.

She hopes to see her children through education.

loans.use: to purchase farm materials.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 48 years-old.  She is married to Peter and together they have two children.  She is a dairy farmer and has been in the business for the past six years.

This is her first loan from Kiva partner KADET LTD.  She will use the loan amount to purchase two heifers which she will raise and add to her number of dairy cows.

She hopes to educate her children and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase two heifers to raise.

loans.name: Mikelly

texts.en:
Mikelly is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Mikelly has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store for which she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for five years. Mikelly is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. 

Mikelly has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Mikelly hopes to improve her business for the sake of educating her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Analisa

texts.en:
Analisa is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children. 

Analisa has a food/retail shop or sari-sari store for which she buys and sells canned goods, snacks, personal care products, home use products and beverages. She has had this business for eight years. She is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages. 

Analisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2012.  In the future, Analisa hopes to improve her business for the sake of educating her children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 51 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.
 
Elsa makes and sells school and office uniforms.  Aside from that she also has a sari-sari store which sells canned goods and snacks. She has had this business for eight years. 

She is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy more textiles for making school and office uniforms.

Elsa has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Elsa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy textiles for making school and office uniforms.

loans.name: Inmar

texts.en:
Inmar is a 33-year-old married man and the father of one child. He has been the owner of an amusement center since 2004, with eight years of experience in this field of work. This is his sixth time requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua and he has a good standing pay back history.

Today Inmar is requesting a loan in order to support his business by adding new entertaining games and doing necessary maintenance to his shop.

Most of his clients are his neighbors, teenagers and foreigners. He started his business with the money he borrowed from a friend, and from his work he was capable of paying back the money to his friend and adding extra equipment to his business, until he was introduced to Al Majmoua, and  he started dealing them.  

Inmar works hard to improve his social and financial situation, and he is willing to develop his business more and more in the future.

loans.use: to support his business with by adding new entertaining games and doing necessary maintenance to his shop.

loans.name: Bayanmunkh

texts.en:
Bayanmunkh lives with her husband and two children in their small house in a peri-urban district of Ulaanbaatar city. She is 46 years old now and  wants to conduct her own grocery store business. She wants to built her own workshop and her husband also will contribute to her business.  She plans that the business income will pay for her children's college tuition fees. Her planned location for the grocery store is a good one.

Bayanmunkh wants to purchase construction materials in order to build a small store. She is a hardworking woman who wants to start her own business. Now she is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT in order to purchase construction materials and electric heating to build a warm store.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a small store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various goods such as: lotions, soap, sugar, clothes, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Sarifa

texts.en:
Sarifa is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 
Sarifa has a store where she sells different kinds of viand. She has had this business for nine years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy the raw ingredients, like vegetables, spices and fresh meat, to make viand.
Sarifa is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Sarifa hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to make viand.

loans.name: Luis Angel

texts.es: Luis Ángel, tiene la edad  de 42 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa y dos hijos  actualmente. El con el crédito pretende comprar una máquina para quitar la maleza del cafetal y además insumos como abonos y fumigaciones  y ayudarse con la mano de obra. El tiene pensado comprar esta máquina para tener el cafetal libre de maleza y con los insumos  tenerlo en excelentes condiciones y  poder generar más ganancias  y obtener una mejor calidad de vida y una estabilidad económica. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Luis Ángel is 42 years old and married. He lives with his wife and two children. With this loan he intends to purchase a machine to remove weeds from his coffee plantation as well as supplies like fertilizer and fumigants and help from a labor force. He plans to buy a machine so he can have weed-free coffee and use the supplies to have it in excellent condition so that he will generate more income and obtain a better quality of life and economic stability.

This is Luis’ first loan from FUDECOSUR. He has not had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided this loan more easily and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase a machine and supplies.

loans.name: Mary Neva Grace

texts.en:
Mary Neva Grace is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children. 
Mary Neva Grace makes and sells longganisa in her community. She has had this business for six years. She has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy the raw ingredients, like fresh meat and spices, to make longganisa.
Mary Neva Grace is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy the raw ingredients to make longganisa

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is 49 years old, single and living in the Philippines. 
He provides habal-habal, or motorcycle, services. He has had this business for five years. He has requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for gasoline.
Victor has been a member of HSPFI since 2012. In the future, Victor hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for gasoline

loans.name: Ayishotu

texts.en: Ayishotu is single and sells sugar and rice at Nyame Bekyere near Abura. She has been in this business for two years. Ayishotu uses her income to pay her utility and housing bills. She needs this loan to purchase bags of rice and sugar to sell. With the new profit, Ayishotu will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice and sugar to sell.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 46 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with four children. 
James has a shop where he sells motor parts. He has had this business for six years. He has requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to purchase more motor parts to resell.
James is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, James hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to purchase motor parts to resell.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has one child.
 
Angelina makes and sells charcoal. She has had this business for eight years. She is requesting a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy more firewood for making charcoals.

Angelina is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Angelina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more firewood for making charcoals

loans.name: Ayman

texts.en:
Ayman is a 22-year-old married man, who started his own construction business in 2010. Ayman specializes in Gibson work and he is an expert in his domain. 
Ayman is a hard worker and very talented in his field. He applied for a YOUTH LOAN from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy the new tools necessary to fulfill his customers' needs and desires.
Ayman will also use part of the loan to pay for his wife's delivery, which is very soon. This will be his first child. He is very excited for this moment, and that's why he is putting so much effort to expand and improve his business (so that he can provide a good and healthy living for his family).
Ayman loves his work--that's why he is creative. He hopes to open a Gibson board factory in the future to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy new tools for his business.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua sells maize porridge. In the picture, she is seen preparing her porridge.  
Ekua lives together with her four children at Nyame Bekyere. She has been selling maize porridge for four years. She uses her income to feed and clothe her children, as well as to pay utility and housing bills and her children's school fees.  
Ekua's loan will be used to purchase bags of maize to prepare her porridge for sale. With the new profit, Ekua will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to prepare her porridge for sale.

loans.name: Jose Anastacio

texts.es: José Anastasio, tiene la edad 48 de  años, está casado y vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos   los cuales les ayudan en las labores del campo. El  pretende con el crédito realizar la compra de concentrado para el mantenimiento de los cerdos de cría y para el engorde de los cerdos pequeños. El cuenta con varios cerdos a su poder y lo que pretende es reforzar el negocio y  darle alimentación con concentrado para su engorde más rápido. El  quiere tener sus animales con el peso ideal para su posterior venta en el mercado de la localidad o lugares aledaños. El quiere generar la mayor cantidad de ganancias para su bienestar  y de la familia  y crecer con el proyecto de cerdos de engorde y cría. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. El  no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
José Anastasio is 48 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and four children, who help him with farm work. He intends to use this loan to purchase nutritional feed for the pigs he raises and to fatten his young pigs. He cares for several pigs and wants to strengthen his business and feed them nutritional feed thereby fattening them more rapidly. He needs to bring his animals to an ideal weight for later sale at the market in his community and at those in neighboring communities.

José wants to generate a larger income for his own well-being and that of his family and expand his business raising and fattening pigs. This is the first loan from FUDECOSUR. He has not had previous loans from state banks, however FUDECOSUR provided him this loan with better terms and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to purchase nutritional feed.

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac is 50 years old. He is married to Hannah and together they have seven children. He is a dairy farmer and has been in the business for the past five years.

This is his fifth loan from KADET LTD. He repaid his previous loans on time. He will use this loan to purchase a dairy cow.

He hopes to purchase a plot of land and build rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 39 years old and married to Mary. They are blessed with three children, aged 12, nine and two years. He runs a shop where he sells a variety of goods. He started this business two years ago and earns a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

He has requested a second loan of KES 50,000 to purchase crates of sodas, bales of maize flour and baking flour, cooking oil and detergents to sell at his store. 

The profit he makes will aid him in educating his children and supporting their needs. His dream is to live a successful life.

loans.use: To purchase crates of soda, bales of maize flour and baking flour, cooking oil and detergents.

loans.name: Salamatu

texts.en:
Salamatu is married to a mason and has three children. She sells waakye (rice and beans cooked together) and serves it with gari, macaroni, meat, and fish stew. Salamatu has been selling waakye for 11 years.  

She uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Salamatu needs this loan to purchase bags of rice, beans, and other ingredients to make waakye. With the new profit, Salamatu will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, beans and other ingredients to make waakye.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 50 years old. He is a widower and supports his two children. John is a farmer and has been in the business for the past 12 years.

This is his fifth loan from KADET LTD. He repaid all his previous loans on time. He will use the loan to purchase fertilizer and seedlings for his farm.

He hopes to improve his living standards and see his children receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase farm supplies.

loans.name: Anderson

texts.en: In the village of Kaloleni, in the coastal region of Kenya, there lives Anderson who is a 45-year-old married man with eight children. Two of his children are in school while the rest are adults. For the last three years, Anderson has been operating a café selling a variety of dishes. He has established a good customer base. His customers describe him as being a caring and humble person. He dreams of opening a kiosk in the future. Demand for more dishes has increased but he says that he has a shortage of capital. He is therefore requesting a loan in the amount of Ksh 30,000 to purchase cooking oil, wheat flour, sugar, and other ingredients. He hopes that this loan will improve his living standards.

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, wheat flour, sugar, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Alima

texts.en:
Alima sells charcoal in Nyame Bekyere. In front of Alima are packages of charcoal ready for sale.  

She is married and has seven children. Her husband is a retried security guard. Alima has been selling charcoal for five years. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Alima will use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Alima wishes to produce the charcoal herself.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Milka

texts.en:
Milkah is 37 years old. She is a  single mother of three. She operates a restaurant and has been in the business for the past three years.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She was introduced to us by one of our field officers. She will use the loan amount to purchase rice, sugar and maize meal for use in her restaurant.

She hopes to be financially stable and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar and maize meal for use in her restaurant.

loans.name: Riad

texts.en:
Riad is a 45-year-old married man living with his wife and four children in Tripoli. Riad opened a barber shop 16 years ago and he's working hard to improve his business. 

This is his second experience as an Al Majmoua borrower. His last loan helped a lot in improving his income, that's why he was excited to apply for the second one. His last loan was requested for buying new products necessary for his business such as gel, shampoo, hair creams, and many other useful things requested by his customers. Today he is applying for the same reason and because such products needs to be updated most of the time, and he has to take good care of the new releases.

Riad is a man with a very good reputation. His customer service is remarkable.

His business is a major support for his family and that's why he  puts so much effort on improving it. He hopes to keep on improving it and attracting new customers.  He is still planning to expand his business to meet with  his customers needs through starting one day facial treatments and many other different services.

loans.use: to buy necessary products for his business.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua sells charcoal at Nyame Bekyere. In front of her are bags of charcoal ready for sale.  She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a security guard. Ekua has been selling charcoal for 10 years. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their children’s school fees. Ekua will use her loan to purchase bags of charcoal to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Ekua wishes to produce the charcoal her self.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Julia Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE TETE CACA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Julia Marina;La socia continua con su negocio de venta de manualidades,a la vez la socia tambien se esta dedicando al negocio de venta de ropa interior ,la socia vende de forma ambulatoria a sus clientes que le solicitan como amistades,familiares entre otros,la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa con muchas ganas de continuar trabajando por su famila,siendo de esta manera que la socia apoya a su familia economicamente.
La socia solicita el credito para la compra de ropa interior al por mayor.


La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “SEÑOR DE TETE CACA” communal bank. The bank is located in the Cusco district, which is part of the province and administrative district of Cusco.

The member is Julia Marina.  She continues in her business of selling crafts; at the same time she is also [engaging] in the business of undergarment sales.  As a street vendor, she sells them to customers that seek her out, like friends, relatives, and others.  This member is a responsible person and has an eager desire to continue working for [the benefit] of her family; thus she [is responsible for] giving economic support to her family.

This [communal bank] member requests a loan in order to purchase undergarments wholesale. She is happy for this loan [opportunity] and she is committed to making her payments when they are due.

loans.use: to purchase of undergarments wholesale.

loans.name: Grupo Virgen Del Cisne Group

texts.es:
Mayra, Maria Eugenia, Hercilia y Antonia forman el grupo Virgen del Cisne. Las cuatro viven en Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, ciudad ubicada entre la Costa y Sierra ecuatoriana. La ciudad es el enlace de varias ciudades del ecuador haciendo de Santo Domingo un punto crucial del comercio Ecuatoriano. Es más, la ciudad abarca la mayoría del mercado ganadero del país. El clima es tropical húmedo y tiene una temperatura que varía de los 18°C a 32°C. Santo Domingo es el hogar de los Tsáchilas, un grupo étnico que existe desde antes de la época colonial. La ciudad es también conocida por su producción de frutas. 

El grupo Virgen del Cisne está compuesto por 4 integrantes que basadas en una fuerte y buena relación crearon un negocio de comercio de ropa, frutas, y comida preparada. Mayra tiene 26 años, tan solo logró completar sus estudios primarios, pero aun no empieza su familia por lo tanto puede dedicar sus energías al oficio. Maria Eugenia tiene 61 años de edad, tampoco tiene ningún compromiso, por lo tanto invierte su tiempo y experiencia en su oficio de comerciante. Zoila Hercilia tiene 47 años. Es madre soltera de un hijo al que tiene que mantener, por lo tanto trabaja duro para que el negocio salga adelante. A sus 54 años, Antonia de Jesús también es madre soltera de 2 hijos. A pesar de que ella no pudo continuar sus estudios secundarios ni superiores, Antonia sueña que sus hijos lo logran. Por lo tanto, quiere que el grupo de Virgen del Cisne prospere y pueda incrementar sus ingresos. 

Aunque las ganas no faltan, es complicado para las cuatro mujeres emprendedoras incrementar los ingresos del negocio por la falta de capital. Es por esto que solicitan un crédito a Kiva para poder comprar más ropa y frutas para disminuir el precio unitario, sillas y mesa para que los clientes se sientan más cómodos, y para hacer otros arreglos necesarios. Con este préstamo, ellas tienen fe en que su negocio va a ser más próspero y poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida para ellas mismas y sus familiares.
texts.en:
Mayra, Maria Eugenia, Hercilia and Antonia make up the communal bank "Virgen del Cisne."  The four women live in Santo Domingo de Los Tsáchilas, a city located between the coast and the Ecuadorian mountains.  This city links the various Ecuadorian cities, making Santo Domingo a crucial point for Ecuadorian commerce.  What's more, the city handles most of the livestock trade in the country.  Its climate is humid and tropical; the temperature varies from 18 to 32 degrees centigrade.  Santo Domingo is home to the Tsáchilas, an ethnic group that existed from before the colonial era.  This city is also known for its production of fruit.

The group "Virgen del Cisne" is made up of 4 members who, based on a strong and good relationship, created their own businesses selling clothing, fruit and prepared meals.  Mayra, 26, only completed elementary school.  She has not yet started a family, because she wants to devote her energy to her business.  Maria Eugenia, 61, is also single, and she invests her time and experience in her business as a merchant.  Zoila Hercilia is 47 years old.  She is the single mother of a son who she has to support.  To do this, she works very hard to get ahead with her business.  Antonia de Jesus, 54, is also a single mother and has 2 children.  Even though she was not able to complete her high school education or go to college, Antonia dreams that her children will achieve this.  Therefore, she wants the "Virgen del Cisne" group to prosper and the members to increase their earnings. 

Although they are strongly motivated, it's difficult for these four enterprising women to increase their income because they lack capital.  For this reason, they are requesting a Kiva loan so that they can buy more clothing and fruit in bulk to reduce the unit price, a table and chairs so that their customers will feel more comfortable, and to make other needed repairs.  With this loan, they have faith that their businesses are going to be more profitable so that they can provide a better quality of life for themselves and their families.

loans.use: to buy clothing and other merchandise to sell

loans.name: Felix Difunto

texts.es:
Felix es un hombre de 44 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su pareja y su hijo, él es una persona muy amable, trabajar y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; Felix ha trabajado desde muy joven para apoyar a sus padres y hermanos, por lamentablemente no pudo determinar sus estudios secundarios, pero le gustaría mucho poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta dedicar un poco de tiempo a la lectura y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia. 
Por iniciativa y con mucho empeño y entusiasmo, día a día Feliz trabaja en su pequeño negocio de venta de artículos para el hogar, él dedica a su negocio un aproximado de 10 horas diarias, Felix se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien debido al trato amable y respetuoso que brinda a sus clientes.
Felix se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mercadería, tales como: utensilios, tenedores, cucharas, espátulas, cuchillos, platos, entre otros artículos; de esta manera Felix contará con su negocio mejor abastecido, con ello espera poder aumentar sus ventas e incrementar sus ingresos económicos, los cuales en un futuro no muy lejano desea utilizar para poder adquirir un puesto de ventas y su casa propia.
texts.en:
Felix is a 44-year-old man. He lives in Nazca with his partner and their son. He is a very kind, hard-working and enthusiastic person that puts all his efforts toward the advancement of his family. Since a very young age, Felix has worked to support his parents and siblings and he unfortunately could not graduate from high school, although he would like to be able to do so. In his free time, Felix reads and at times makes delicious rice with chicken that he shares with his family.
On his own initiative and with a lot of effort and enthusiasm, Felix works every day in his small shop selling household goods. He works for about 10 hours a day. He is comfortable doing his job and thinks he does okay because he treats his customers with kindness and respect. 
Felix is very grateful to Kiva loaners because thanks to their help he will be able to purchase merchandise such as utensils, forks, spoons, spatulas, knives and plates, among others. Thus, his business will be stocked better, allowing him to increase his sales and income, with which he expects to buy his own sales booth and this own house in a not very distant future.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise such as utensils, forks, spoons, spatulas, knives, plates, etc.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma tiene 39 años y viven en la ciudad de Latacunga. Latacunga es la capital de Cotopaxi, provincia ubicada en la Sierra central ecuatoriana. El clima es templado y tiene una temperatura promedio de 12°C. La ciudad se caracteriza por un bello paisaje de la cordillera de los Andes y estar en las faldas del volcán activo más alto del mundo, el Cotopaxi, que ya ha destruido a la ciudad dos veces desde su fundación. Latacunga tiene un estilo colonial muy agradable. Es también representante del folclor ecuatoriano, pues tiene festividades como la Mama Negra que junta tradiciones indígenas, españolas y afroecuatorianas. 

Norma es divorciada y vive sola con sus hijos. Hace 25 años empezó su negocio ambulante de venta de relojes y baterías para los mismos con la ayuda de su hermana. Trabaja más de ocho horas diarias para incrementar sus ingresos y poder sacar adelante a sus hijos. Por medio de Fundación Alternativa, Norma solicita un crédito a Kiva para poder tener su relojería propia para poder mejorar la calidad de sus servicios, ofrecer mejores productos y de una manera más organizada. De esta manera podrá incrementar su negocio y quiere darles a sus hijos la educación secundaria y superior que ella nunca tuvo. Con el crédito comprará repuestos y herramientas para desempeñarse de manera independiente.
texts.en:
Norma is 39  years old and lives in the city of Latacunga. Latacunga is the capital of Cotopaxi, a province located in the central Ecuadorian sierra.The climate is mild, with an average temperature of 12°C. The city is known for its beautiul surroundings in the Andean range and for being on the slopes of the highest active volcano in the world, Cotopaxi, which has destroyed the city twice since it was founded. Latacunga has a very pleasant colonial style. It is also representative of Ecuadorian folklore, as it as its traditional festivals such as La Mama Negra that combines indigenous, Spanish and Afro-Ecuadorian traditions. 

Norma is divorced and lives alone with her children. Twenty five years ago, she started her street vendor business selling watches, clocks and batteries for these, with the help of her sister. She works more than eight hours a day to increase her income and be able to get her children ahead. Through the Fundación Alternativa, Norma is asking for a Kiva loan to be able to have her own watch/ clock shop to improve her quality of her services, offer better products and do all this in a more organized way. In thi that she s way, she will be able to grow her business. She wants to give her children a secondary and post-secondary education that she never had. With the loan, she will buy replacement parts and tools to work independently.

loans.use: to be able to have her own watch and clock shop

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge es un  hombre de 20 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Mala con su pareja y su bebé recién nacido; a pesar de ser tan joven Jorge es muy trabajador y entusiasta, que junto con su pareja dedican todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por la necesidad de trabajar y solventar sus gastos no pudo cursar una carrera profesional, pero le gustaría poder hacerlo, en sus ratos libres le gusta relajarse escuchando música y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimo Tallarines Rojos para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación Jorge trabaja en una mina de su ciudad como obrero perforista, él labora un aproximado de 12 horas diarias y se siente a gusto realizando su labor, ya que sus jefes lo consideran mucho por su buen desempeño y trato amable hacia los demás.
Jorge se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar los acabados de su vivienda, tales como tarrajeo, pintado y puesta de ventanas; de esta manera Jorge tendrá su hogar en mejores condiciones y con ello podrá  brindar mayor bienestar y seguridad para su familia; así él espera poder seguir trabajando y luchando para salir adelante.
texts.en:
Jorge, 20, lives in Cañete (Mala district) with his partner and their newborn baby. Despite his young age, he is a hard-working, enthusiastic man. Together with his partner, they make every effort to move on in life. Unfortunately, due to the need to work and support himself he was not able to attend college but he'd like to do so. In his free time he likes to relax listening to music and at times he cooks delicious red noodles to share with his family. 
On his own initiative and with a lot of effort and enthusiasm, Jorge works on a mine in his city as a perforator. He works for about 12 hours a day and feels comfortable doing his job because his bosses appreciate him because of his good performance and kindness to others. 
Jorge is very grateful to Kiva loaners because thanks to their help he will be able to make the building finishings of his house such as plastering, painting and installing windows. Thus, Jorge will be able to have a more appropriate and safe house, providing the necessary conditions for the welfare and better development of his family. He expects to be able to continue working and progress in life.

loans.use: to make the building finishings of his house such as plastering, painting and installing windows

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 24 years old. She is married to Stephen and together they have two children who are six and three years old. She operates a retail shop and has been in the business for the past four years.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD. She will use the loan to purchase one bag of rice and one bag of sugar.

She hopes to expand her business to a wholesale store.

loans.use: to purchase rice and sugar.

loans.name: Dora Delia

texts.es:
La socia  es la señorita Dora, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia es profesora y se sigue dedicando a enseñanza en un colegio de la ciudad. Dora esta retribuyendo el esfuerzo que hicieron sus padres al sacarla profesional y los está ayudando con el mantenimiento de su casa y con la compra de algunos electrodomésticos y muebles para arreglar y decorar su vivienda. Nuestra socia en esta oportunidad invertirá su préstamo para pagar algunas responsabilidades propias de su casa como los servicios básicos de agua, luz y arbitrios municipales.
Dora tiene el sueño de que algún día cercano poder independizarse y conformar su propio hogar y tener hijos, por lo pronto ayuda a sus padres y ahorra, por ello  está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y poder ahorrar para el futuro.
texts.en:
Our featured member is Dora. She is a member of “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” Communal Bank in Cusco, Perú. She is a teacher and continues to teach at a school in the city. Dora is giving back to her parents for the efforts they made in supporting her professional studies and she is helping them to maintain their house and purchase some appliances and furniture to fix and decorate their home. This time, our member will invest her loan in paying some obligations of her own house such as water, electricity and local taxes. 
Dora's dream is to become fully independent and to have her own home and children. For now she helps her parents and saves. She is very thankful to KIVA because it allows her to provide her family with a better quality of life and to save for her future.

loans.use: to pay her water and electricity bills

loans.name: Papio

texts.es: Un préstamo de 42,000 pesos ayudará a Papio a comprar más mercancía para aumentar el inventario de su negocio de venta de piezas de repuestos para carros y motocicletas. Papio tiene este negocio desde hace más de diez años en una de las calles principales de su comunidad. Su motivación para iniciar este negocio fue el ver cómo iba aumentando la cantidad de habitantes en la comunidad, así como la cantidad de vehículos de motor. Muchos tenían que viajar largas distancias para encontrar una tienda de venta de repuestos para vehículos. Papio es casado y tiene cuatro hijos el mayor tiene 32 y la menor 16. Sólo la menor vive en casa con él y su esposa, ya que los demás se han casado. Su hija está en la escuela secundaria. El mayor deseo de Papio es poder trasladar el local de su negocio a una plaza comercial, donde le visite una mayor cantidad de clientes.
texts.en:
A loan of 42,000 pesos will help Papio to buy more merchandise to increase his business' inventory of repair parts for cars and motorcycles. Papio has had this business for more than 10 years, located on one of the main streets in his community. His motivation for starting the business was seeing how the population of his community was growing, and the number of motor vehicles along with it. Many people had to travel long distances to find a car repair shop. 

Papio is married and has 4 children, the eldest is 32 and the youngest is 16. Only the youngest lives at home with him and his wife, as the rest have married. His daughter is in high school. Papio's greatest desire is to be able to move his business to a mall where more customers will visit him.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to increase his inventory of car and motorcycle repair parts.

loans.name: Mildred

texts.en: Mildred is a 31-year-old woman with two children who are 13 and 7 years old. She is married to Francis, a school inspector. Together they operate a shop selling a variety of consumer goods. She says that it has been a profitable project and she wishes to expand this business to a wholesale shop in future. She is working hard to ensure that her children are educated. They live in a rental house though she says that they have plans to construct their house soon. She is taking out a loan of KSH 50,000 to add stock of rice, beans, salt, and other fast selling products. However, she says that her greatest challenge is high transport costs.

loans.use: to buy more rice, beans, salt, and other fast selling products.

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba is a fishmonger at Nyame Bekyere near Abura. She buys fresh fish and smokes it to sell. Aba has been in this business for 10 years now. She is married to a driver and has two children.  Aba uses her income to assist her husband in paying their utility bills.  She will use her loan to purchase a large quantity of fresh fish to smoke to sell. With the new profit, Aba wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantiy of fresh fish

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Isabel, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se sigue dedicando al comercio de ganado bovino y también paralelamente se dedica a la atención de su picantería, que es un pequeño restaurante típico. Isabel es madre de una familia muy numerosa, y por ellos se sacrifica todos los días para poder proporcionarles una mejor educación y alimentación a cada uno de sus hijos. La socia en esta oportunidad invertirá su préstamo para comprar mercadería e insumos para capitalizar su picantería y comprar productos como Arroz, Menestras, papas etc.
Isabel está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y poder darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en: Our member is Isabel from the “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” Communal Bank in Cusco, Perú. Our member still has a cattle business and runs her restaurant at the same time. She is the mother of a very large family and she sacrifices for them every day so each one of her children can have better education and food. This time, our member will invest her loan in the purchase of merchandise and supplies in order to capitalize her restaurant and buy products such as rice, stews, potatoes and others. She is very thankful to Kiva because it allows her to offer a better quality of life to her family and a better education for her children.

loans.use: to purchase products such as rice, stews and potatoes for her typical food restaurant

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La socia se dedica al negocio de venta de zapatos y de ropa,la socia vende pantalones,chompas,casacas y blusas,la socia vende para mujeres y varones,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia vende a credito tanto los zapatos y la ropa,ella vende en forma independiente llevando a lugares como insticiones y publico en general,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda donde pueda vender zapatos y ropa.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pantalones,blusas y chompas y tambien para comprar zapatos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This lending club member sells shoes and clothing like pants, sweaters, jackets and blouses. She sells clothing for men and women, working from 8:00am to 6:00pm. She sells everything on credit, working independently and carrying her products to businesses and the general public. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell clothing and shoes. She asks for a loan to buy shores, blouses and sweaters as well as shoes.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, sweaters and shoes.

loans.name: Nhanh's Group

texts.en:
Nhanh is 30 years old and married. Her family consists of five people: herself, her husband, and her three children and together they are living in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang Province. She is responsible for all of her children as they are too young to attend school. In order to manage the daily basic needs of the entire family, she has been engaged in growing a rice crop on eight hectares of farmland for five years and her husband helps her to earn extra income via fishing. From the current business and the dual income, she can earn about 20,000 KHR and save about 10,000 KHR after the necessary expenses are deducted. The main challenge for her is the low crop yields caused by drought.

This is Nhanh’s group microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is the group leader of the group, which consists of five female members. This is her third loan. Three members are on their fourth loan and the remaining one is on her sixth loan. With success, the past two loans that she has completely repaid have helped her not only to grow her crop but also to relieve her family’s burden and improve its livelihood. With a good business, she is seeking a new loan of KHR 1,400,000, the same amount as the other four members. She will use her loan to buy fertilizers and gasoline for pumping water for her farmland. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her family’s income to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Cyrus

texts.en:
Cyrus is a 49-year-old businessman married to Sabina who is a mixed crop farmer. They are blessed with five children. He has been distributing construction stones for the past 10 years with a monthly income of KES 10,500, which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Cyrus will use the loan to buy more stones to sell. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hope and dream is to buy a lorry for transporting stones to his customers.

loans.use: to buy more stones to sell

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Lucia, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. Nuestra socia se sigue dedicando a la crianza de animales menores en su casa y también sigue realizando trabajos en bisutería, elaborando productos como aretes, collares, pulseras, etc. Lucia es madre de dos niños, y por ellos se sacrifica todos los días para poder proporcionarles una mejor educación y alimentación. La socia en esta oportunidad invertirá su préstamo para comprar materiales como accesorios y alambres para la elaboración de productos de bisutería.
Lucia está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y poder darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Lucia belongs to the village bank "Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla" in the city of Cusco, Peru. She continues raising small animals in her home and also making jewelry - products like earrings, necklaces, bracelets, etc. Lucia is a mother of two children, for whom she sacrifices daily to be able to give them a better education and nutrition. On this occasion she will invest her loan in materials like accessories and wires to make jewelry.

Lucia is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to give her family a better quality of life and her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy materials like accessories and wires to make jewelry.

loans.name: Berioska

texts.es:
La socia se dedica al negocio de venta de zapatos,ella vende zapatos para mujer y varones,la socia vende en forma independiente la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,en algunas oportunidades la socia da credito a las socias para que compren zapatos,el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda donde pueda vender zapatos en sus tiempos libres a la socia le gusta preparar chocolates,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de zapatos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar zapatos al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The lending club member sells shoes for men and women. She works independently, selling shoes from 8:00am to 6:00pm. Sometimes she gives credit to the other members who buy shoes. Her dream is to have a store where she can sell her shoes. In her free time she likes to make chocolate. She dreams of growing her business selling shoes. She asks for a loan to buy shoes in bulk.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy shoes in bulk.

loans.name: Luz  Marina

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes,al socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y galletas,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,en sus tiempos libres la socia le gusta hacer tortas,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y galletas al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The lending club member has a grocery store where she sells basic necessities like rice, sugar, milk and cookies. She works from 8:00am to 10:00pm. In her free time she likes to make cakes. Her dream is to increase the size of her grocery store. She asks for a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies in bulk.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies in bulk.

loans.name: Rosa Judith

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de restaurant,la socia prepara desayunos,almuerzos y cenas,la socia prepara arroz con pollo,sopas y pollo al horno,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia a veces solo prepara almuerzos y cenas porque los productos estan a alto precio y no le alcanza para que compre,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de restaurant.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pollo,verduras y carne.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The lending club member has a restaurant where she makes breakfasts, lunches and dinners. She makes chicken and rice, soups and roasted chicken, working from 8:00am until 6:00pm. She sometimes only makes lunches and dinners because the products are expensive and she can't buy enough. Her dream is to increase the size of her restaurant. She asks for a loan to buy chicken, vegetables and meat.

She is happy about the loan and promises to make her payments according to schedule.

loans.use: to buy chicken, vegetables and meat.

loans.name: Pos' Group

texts.en:
Pos is a 56-year-old mother of seven children. One of her children is staying with the family and works at the rice field. Pos and her family live in a rural village of Moung Russey. They have been farming rice for over six years to support themselves. Their business struggles when there is a natural disaster like drought, which destroyed their crops. 

Pos obtained her first loan from VisionFund in 2010, which she has completely paid back. The first loan helped to improve the living condition of her family and also helped to expand her business. This time, Pos leads a group with one other woman to apply for a new loan. As leader, Pos will use her portion to cultivate her rice farm and then will use some part of it to buy seeds, fertilizers and gasoline for a water pump. Pos really hopes that this loan will allow her to make more income so that she can gradually expand her business and also buy a buffalo.

loans.use: To prepare farmland, and to buy seeds, fertilizers and gasoline for a water pump

loans.name: Maria  Antonieta

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes pero el negocio de artesania lo cerro porque no le fue muy bien en este negocio porque la artesania esta a precios altos,la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche y galletas,la socia vende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes.La socia solicita el credito para comprar arroz,azucar,leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member continues to work at her grocery store but she had to close her folk-art store, as the business did not go well. The folk-art was priced too high. This member sells basic grocery items such as rice, sugar, milk and cookies. She works from 8:00am until 10pm. Her dream is to expand her grocery store. She is asking for this loan in order to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies. This member is happy for the opportunity to have this loan and promises to pay her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk and cookies.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La socia  es la señorita Hilda, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia se sigue dedicando a vender comida en uno de los mercados de su comunidad. Hilda  realiza esta actividad hace mucho tiempo y es con esta que ha sacado adelante a todos sus hijos, ella sueña con sacar profesionales a sus hijos, por ello se esfuerza y trabaja todos los días, para poder ahorrar y pagar su educación.
Hilda  invertirá su préstamo para comprar insumos como arroz, menestras,  papas etc. para su comercio.
Hilda está muy feliz y agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y ayudarla a mantener y desarrollarse en sus actividades económicas.
texts.en:
This group member is named Miss Hilda. She belongs to “The Master of Miracles of Chimpahuaylla” Community Bank in Cusco City, Peru. This member continues to sell food in one of the markets in her community. Hilda has been doing this for a long time and it is how she has helped all her children to progress. She dreams that her children will be professionals. This is why she makes such an effort and why she works each day. She saves and she pays for her children’s education.
Hilda will use this loan to pay for goods such as rice, vegetables, potatoes, etc. for her business.
Hilda is very happy and grateful to KIVA as they give her a better quality of life for her family and the loan helps her to maintain and develop her economic activities.

loans.use: to buy rice, vegetables and potatoes.

loans.name: Nur's Group

texts.en:
Nur is 37 years old and she is married with three daughters, all of whom are still her dependents and in school. She resides in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She has been making a living through growing cassava for several years. Nur earns approximately 20,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. Lack of capital to support her plantation is the main challenge for her business.

Nur’s group consists of two members and this is the fifth cycle for her with VisionFund while the other member has just joined VisionFund for this cycle. She has completely paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group to request a loan with VisionFund. Nur will use her portion of the loan to purchase fertilizers for her farmland and buy pesticide to spray her crops. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income from the current business so as to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La socia se dedica al negocio de crianza de animales como pollos,la socia los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en los diferentes mercados,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,la socia vende entre 20 a 30 pollos y en sus tiempos libres la socia le gusta preparar postres,el sueño de la socia es tener una granja donde pueda criar los pollos.La socia solicita el credito para comprar pollos y alimentos para los pollos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: This member works raising animals such as chickens. She helps the animals grow and get fat and then she sells them in different markets in the city. She works from 8:00am until 6:00pm. She sells between 20 and 30 chickens. In her free time she likes to make desserts. Her dream is to have a ranch where she can raise chickens. She is asking for this loan in order to buy chickens and feed.

loans.use: to buy chickens and feed.

loans.name: Thei's Group

texts.en:
Thei, 23, is from a rural village located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is married and responsible for one baby daughter. She and her husband earn a living through farming rice. They have been in this business for four years. The current business earns her family about 22,000 KHR per day. Lack of water supply is still the main challenge for her business.

Thei has been with VisionFund for five cycles while the other member has been with VisionFund for two cycles. The past loans have helped her relieve the family’s burden and improve their livelihood. Now she is leading her group of two to apply for a loan with VisionFund. Thei, who is the leader, will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and pay for labor costs and gasoline. She hopes to make more income from the current business so as to improve her family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland

loans.name: Fluturije

texts.en:
Fluturije is an Egyptian woman from the vulnerable ethnic minority community of south eastern Albania.  She is fourty three and married and has three children; twenty, sixteen and fourteen. Fluturije spent quite a few years in Greece as an immigrant but due to the economic situation there, she has come back to live with her own family in their little village. Since then, she has become engaged in the agricultural sector and she enjoys it so far. Yet, there have been challenges including the lack of money to buy equipment for plowing and also other things related to the agribusiness. To be able to buy what she needed, she had requested three loans in the past, one at a time, from the VisionFund Albania institution. She is requesting another loan, yet this time she wants to open a pit that will enable her to irrigate the plants: potatoes, beans, garlic and tomatoes.
Fluturije has been able to establish a good clientele thanks to her hard work and personable nature. 
She is respected by all locals and the VFA’s staff.

loans.use: To open a water pit to irrigate her plants

loans.name: Hilda Luciana

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Luciana, ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de los Milagros de Chimpahuaylla” de la ciudad del Cusco – Perú. La socia se sigue dedicando a la venta de comida en uno de los mercados de su comunidad. Luciana realiza esta actividad hace tiempo y es con esta que ha sacado adelante a todos sus hijos, todos aun pequeños y dependientes de ella.  Luciana trabaja para poder darles a sus hijos una casa, alimento y educación, y por ello invertirá su préstamo para comprar insumos como arroz, menestras,  papas, semillas etc. para su comercio de venta de comida.
Luciana está muy feliz y agradecida con KIVA por permitirle dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y ayudarla a mantener y desarrollarse en sus actividades económicas.
texts.en: This member is named Mrs. Luciana. She belongs to “The Master of Miracles of Chimpahuaylla” Community Bank in Cusco City, Peru. She continues with her business of selling food in the markets of her community. She has been doing this activity for a long time. She has used the proceeds from her business to help her children succeed from the time they were young until they became independent. Luciana works in order to give her children a home, food and an education. She will use this loan to buy supplies such as rice, vegetables, potatoes, seeds etc. for her food sales business.

loans.use: to buy rice, vegetables, potatoes, onions and seeds.

loans.name: Det's Group

texts.en:
Living in a thatched roof house in a rural village of the Sangke district of Battambang province, Det is 28 years old and married with two children, one son and one daughter, both of whom are still dependent on her and in school. 

To make a living, Det has been in rice growing for several years and her husband supplements the family’s income by working as a policeman in a local area. From her current business, she is able to earn about KHR 30,000 per day. However, low crop yield is still the main challenge in her business. 

Det has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for four cycles and completely paid back past loans, while the other member has been with VisionFund for eight cycles. The past loans have helped her to support her children’s education and buy cows to raise. Now she is leading the group of two and asking for a loan of KHR 1,300,000. 

Det will use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland. To earn additional income, she plans to raise various kinds of animals such as pigs, cows, chickens, etc. She hopes to earn more income from the current business so as to improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 45-year-old married man, living with his wife and four children in Beirut. Mohamad has been selling shoes and bags for 30 years. He moved to the present shop in 2001 and he is very happy that he did this move because his shop is located in an important market with a high population.
Mohamad is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, in order to increase his business capital by purchasing newly released shoes and bags especially for the summer season.
Mohamad's long experience gave him customer's trust and support. That's why he insists on exceeding their expectations.
He hopes to keep providing his family with the best living conditions and at the same time supporting his business as much as he can.

loans.use: To improve his business by adding the new shoes collection

loans.name: Grimaldina

texts.es:
La socia trabaja en una empresa publica,la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m,la socia no puede pasar mucho tiempo con sus hijos por su trabajo,pero en sus ratos libres la socia prepara postres y van a pasear al parque,el sueño de la socia es que sus hijos terminen de estudiar.La socia solicita el credito para pagar las mensualidades de sus  estudios de sus hijos.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member works in a public company. She works from 8:00am until 5:00pm. She is not able to spend much time with her children because of her work. In her free time she makes desserts, which she sells in the park. Her dream for the future is for her children to complete their education. She is asking for this loan in order to pay for the monthly school fees for her children.
She is happy for the opportunity to have this loan and promises to pay her payments on time.

loans.use: to pay for the monthly school costs for her children.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is applying for her second loan from KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Alice will use the loan to buy more fresh vegetables from farmers to sell in her business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to start a green grocer business and improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fresh vegetables from farmers.

loans.name: Silivia

texts.en:
Silivia is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past two years, Silivia has been working hard to manage her bakery which bakes cakes for weddings. 

To help expand her business, Silivia has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy baking powder and other ingredients, and will help Silivia to generate greater profits and reinvest in her business. She hopes that in the future she will be able to have a large shop where someone else will sell wedding gowns and she will sell cakes. 

Silivia is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy baking powder and other ingredients

loans.name: Chanda's Group

texts.en:
Chanda is a 44-year-old married woman who is responsible for three daughters, all of whom are dependent on her and some of whom are in school. Chanda lives with her family in a rural village in the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Cambodia. She is a midwife and supplements her family’s income by selling medicines in the local area. Having been in this business for more than 20 years, she earns about 32,000 KHR per day to meet her family's needs.

Chanda’s group consists of two members who have both been with VisionFund for five cycles. Chanda has successfully used her past loans to support her children’s education. Now, she is leading the group to apply for a loan from VisionFund. Chanda is going to use her portion to buy more medicines to sell. She hopes to earn more income so as to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy more medicines to sell

loans.name: Vanara's Group

texts.en:
Vanara is a 42-year-old father of one daughter and two sons, all of whom are still dependent on him and in school. He lives in a rural village in the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province, Cambodia. To make a living, he and his wife have been making hashed fish meat to sell for the past 20 years. Together, they can earn about KHR 90,000 per day to meet the family’s needs.

This is the second micro-loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund for Vanara’s group of two. The previous loan has helped his family with a better living standard. Now, he is leading his group to apply for a loan of KHR 1,200,000 each. Vanara, who is the leader, will use his portion to buy raw materials such as fish, banana leaves, etc., for his current business. He hopes that this loan will enable him to earn more income to improve his standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fish, banana leaves, etc., for his hashed fish meat business

loans.name: Mourn's Group

texts.en:
Mourn, aged 41, lives in a rural area of the Thmor Koul district in Battambang province, Cambodia. She is the married mother of four children, three of whom live with their family, sometimes working as construction workers to support their living. To earn a living, Mourn has been working as a rice farmer for almost 20 years. However, the lack of capital to support her paddy field is still the main challenge for her business.

Mourn has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for one cycle and she completely repaid her previous loan while the other member is a first loan cycle client. Now, Mourn is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and rice seeds for her farmland, and will use a portion to buy gasoline to pump water onto the farmland. Mourn hopes to increase her crop yield in order to increase her income to achieve a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and rice seeds, and gasoline for pumping water for her farmland

loans.name: C2938 Girisuku Group

texts.en:
Betty is 35 years old and is married with three children aged between six and 12 years old. She also takes care of one relative who is 10 years old. Betty sells various goods such as potatoes, bananas, rice, etc. She is the president of the group called "C2938 Girisuku" in the local language. Betty is the one woman in front of the others in the photo. 

She currently employs one person to help her and has five years of experience in her business. Betty operates her business from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. every day of the week except on Sunday. 

Betty has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to buy various goods such as potatoes, bananas, rice, etc. to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save money for her future, and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy various goods such as potatoes, bananas, rice, etc. to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rashidah's Group

texts.en:
Rashidah's group is comprised of three hard-working women. Rashidah is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past year, Rashidah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells milk and charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Rashidah has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal to sell, and will help Rashidah to generate greater profits and buy more milk and a refrigerator. She hopes that in the future she will be able to enlarge her business. 

Rashidah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Phalla's Group

texts.en:
Aged 28 years old, Phalla is a rural villager from the Ek Phnom district of Battambang province. She earns a living through growing rice and her husband is a fisherman: they have been in these businesses for almost a year. They are able to earn about KHR 20,000 per day to meet the family's needs. Phalla has two sons, both of whom are dependent on her. 

Her group consists of two members. She is a fourth loan cycle client with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, while the other member is a second loan cycle client. Phalla has completely repaid her past loans which have helped her with sufficient food to support her family. Now leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund, Phalla will use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and will use a portion of the loan to buy fishing materials such as fishing net, hooks, etc. She hopes that this loan will enable her to earn more income in order to have a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her farmland and fishing materials

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is 36 years old and is married to Julius: they are blessed with three children. She runs a tailoring business which has been in operation for the past five years, earning a monthly income of KES 10,000.

Irine has applied for her fifth loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD after successfully paying back her previous loans. She’ll use the loan to purchase textile materials to sell and a sewing machine. 

Irine plans to use the anticipated profits for family sustenance and the remaining amount to pay her children's school fees. Her dreams and hopes are that her business prospers and that she achieves her goals in life.

loans.use: To purchase textile materials to sell and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 20-year-old single man who has been working in his own business in Gibson interior design decorations for the past three years. He is very talented and is recommended by most of his customers. Ali loves his business a lot which is why he succeeds in it.

Ali has applied for a Youth Loan from Kiva partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy necessary products and tools for his business. He is already an Al Majmoua borrower: his previous loan helped a lot to improve his business and increase its capital.

That's why Ali is very excited about this requested loan. He is planning to expand his business more and more in the future and, of course, he will employ someone to help him respond to customers' requests.

loans.use: To buy necessary products and tools for his business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stock of micro-solar lighting kits from Barefoot Power.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline, aged 25, is from Kisumu and is married to Joseph: they have four children aged between two and 10 years. Everline has operated a fish selling business for the past six years and earns a monthly income of KES 2,000. 

She is taking out her first loan from KADET LTD which she will use to buy more fish to sell. Everline will use her profits to boost her stock of fish. Her dream is to be a successful entrepreneur.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a married woman who lives in the south of the city together with her husband. They don't yet have any children. Faith has been selling clothes for six years since she started her business to earn an income for her family and improve her household's welfare. 

She is currently applying for a Kiva loan. It is her second loan from Yehu: her previous loan enabled her to have capital available. This has increased her possibilities for buying merchandise and increased her sales' volumes. Faith will use her Kiva loan to respond to orders that her new customers have promised to place with her. These are customers who have been referred to her and who will help her to strengthen her business even further. Faith will buy larger quantities of clothes in the newest fashions. Faith plans to open a boutique in future. Her biggest challenge is the high cost of transportation.

loans.use: to buy clothes in the newest fashions

loans.name: Maria's Group

texts.en:
Maria's Group is comprised of two hard-working women. Maria is 21 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, one of whom is currently in school. For the past four years, Maria has been working hard to manage her salon which styles hair for women. 

To help expand her business, Maria has requested a loan of 700,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cosmetics to sell, and will help her to generate greater profits and save her profits. Maria hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land. 

Maria is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy the special vegetables and fruits that she preserves for her customers

loans.name: Winnie's Group

texts.en:
Winnie's Group is comprised of seven hard-working women. Winnie is 21 years old, is single and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala West region of Uganda. For the past four years, Winnie has been working hard to manage her retail shop where she sells sugar, beans, rice and salt. 

To help expand her business, Winnie has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a refrigerator and will help Winnie to generate greater profits and buy a plot of land. She hopes that in the future she will be able to build her own house and buy a car. 

Winnie is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Sandrah

texts.en:
Sandrah is 17 years old, is single and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala West region of Uganda. For the past two years, Sandrah has been working hard to manage her salon where she styles and plaits hair. 

To help expand her business, Sandrah has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a hairdryer and cosmetics, and will help Sandrah to generate greater profits and grow her business by acquiring assets. Sandrah hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land and have a shop from which to sell spare parts. 

Sandrah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy a hairdryer and cosmetics

loans.name: Teopista

texts.en:
Teopista is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kyengera in the Kampala West region of Uganda. She is married and has one child. For the past year, Teopista has been working hard to manage her farm which grows vegetables like cabbage and eggplant. 

To help expand her business, Teopista has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more seeds for her farm, and will help Teopista to generate greater profits and allow her to finish her home. She hopes that in the future she will be able to buy another plot of land for farming. 

Teopista is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more seeds for her farm

loans.name: Tarek

texts.en:
Tarek is a 51-year-old married man and the father of three children. He has been working selling spare parts for cars since 1987.
